verses.en: If someone who promotes peace is there, your peace will rest on them; if not, it will return to you.

verses.zh: 你们要住在那家，吃喝他们所供给的，因为工人得工价是应当的。不要从这家搬到那家。
verses.en: Stay there, eating and drinking whatever they give you, for the worker deserves his wages. Do not move around from house to house.

verses.zh: 无论进哪一城，人若接待你们，给你们摆上什么，你们就吃什么。
verses.en: When you enter a town and are welcomed, eat what is offered to you.

verses.zh: 要医治那城里的病人，对他们说：神的国临近你们了。
verses.en: Heal the sick who are there and tell them, 'The kingdom of God has come near to you.'

verses.zh: 无论进哪一城，人若不接待你们，你们就到街上去，说：
verses.en: But when you enter a town and are not welcomed, go into its streets and say,

verses.zh: 连你们城里的尘土，我们跺下去，也当着你们的面，抹掉。你们当知道神的国临近了。
verses.en: 'Even the dust of your town we wipe from our feet as a warning to you. Yet be sure of this: The kingdom of God has come near.'

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，当审判的日子，所多玛所受的，比那城还容易受呢！
verses.en: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town.

verses.zh: 哥拉汛哪，你有祸了！伯赛大啊，你有祸了！因为在你们中间所行的异能，若行在推罗、西顿，他们早已披麻蒙灰，坐在地上悔改了。
verses.en: 'Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.zh: 当审判的日子，推罗、西顿所受的，比你们还容易受呢！
verses.en: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.

verses.zh: 迦百农啊，你已经升到天上，将来必坠落阴间。'
verses.en: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted to the heavens? No, you will go down to Hades.

verses.zh: 又对门徒说：'听从你们的，就是听从我；弃绝你们的，就是弃绝我；弃绝我的，就是弃绝那差我来的。'
verses.en: Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.'

verses.zh: 那七十个人欢欢喜喜地回来，说：'主啊！因你的名，就是鬼也服了我们。'
verses.en: The seventy-two returned with joy and said, 'Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'我曾看见撒但从天上坠落，像闪电一样。
verses.en: He replied, 'I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.

verses.zh: 我已经给你们权柄，可以践踏蛇和蝎子，又胜过仇敌一切的能力，并没有什么能害你们。
verses.en: I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you.

verses.zh: 然而，不要因鬼服了你们就欢喜，要因你们的名记录在天上欢喜。'
verses.en: However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.'

verses.zh: 正当那时，耶稣被圣灵感动就欢乐，说：'父啊，天地的主，我感谢你！因为你将这些事向聪明通达人就藏起来，向婴孩就显出来。父啊！是的，因为你的美意本是如此。
verses.en: At that time Jesus, full of joy through the Holy Spirit, said, 'I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this is what you were pleased to do.

verses.zh: 一切所有的，都是我父交付我的。除了父，没有人知道子是谁；除了子和子所愿意指示的，没有人知道父是谁。'
verses.en: All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.'

verses.zh: 耶稣转身暗暗地对门徒说：'看见你们所看见的，那眼睛是有福的。
verses.en: Then he turned to his disciples and said privately, 'Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，从前有许多先知和君王，要看你们所看的，却没有看见；要听你们所听的，却没有听见。'
verses.en: For I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.'

verses.zh: 有一个律法师起来试探耶稣，说：'夫子！我当做什么才可以承受永生？'
verses.en: On one occasion an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus. 'Teacher,' he asked, 'what must I do to inherit eternal life?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'律法上写的是什么？你念的是怎样呢？'
verses.en: 'What is written in the Law?' he replied. 'How do you read it?'

verses.zh: 他回答说：'你要尽心、尽性、尽力、尽意爱主你的神，又要爱邻舍如同自己。'
verses.en: He answered, 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind'; and, 'Love your neighbor as yourself.''

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你回答的是。你这样行，就必得永生。'
verses.en: 'You have answered correctly,' Jesus replied. 'Do this and you will live.'

verses.zh: 那人要显明自己有理，就对耶稣说：'谁是我的邻舍呢？'
verses.en: But he wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, 'And who is my neighbor?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'有一个人从耶路撒冷下耶利哥去，落在强盗手中。他们剥去他的衣裳，把他打个半死，就丢下他走了。
verses.en: In reply Jesus said: 'A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, when he was attacked by robbers. They stripped him of his clothes, beat him and went away, leaving him half dead.

verses.zh: 偶然有一个祭司从这条路下来，看见他就从那边过去了。
verses.en: A priest happened to be going down the same road, and when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.

verses.zh: 又有一个利未人来到这地方，看见他，也照样从那边过去了。
verses.en: So too, a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.

verses.zh: 惟有一个撒玛利亚人行路来到那里，看见他就动了慈心，
verses.en: But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him.

verses.zh: 上前用油和酒倒在他的伤处，包裹好了，扶他骑上自己的牲口，带到店里去照应他。
verses.en: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he put the man on his own donkey, brought him to an inn and took care of him.

verses.zh: 第二天拿出二钱银子来，交给店主，说：你且照应他；此外所费用的，我回来必还你。
verses.en: The next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper. 'Look after him,' he said, 'and when I return, I will reimburse you for any extra expense you may have.'

verses.zh: 你想，这三个人哪一个是落在强盗手中的邻舍呢？'
verses.en: 'Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of robbers?'

verses.zh: 他说：'是怜悯他的。'耶稣说：'你去照样行吧！'
verses.en: The expert in the law replied, 'The one who had mercy on him.' Jesus told him, 'Go and do likewise.'

verses.zh: 他们走路的时候，耶稣进了一个村庄。有一个女人名叫马大，接他到自己家里。
verses.en: As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.

verses.zh: 她有一个妹子名叫马利亚，在耶稣脚前坐着听他的道。
verses.en: She had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet listening to what he said.

verses.zh: 马大伺候的事多，心里忙乱，就进前来说：'主啊，我的妹子留下我一个人伺候，你不在意吗？请吩咐她来帮助我。'
verses.en: But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, 'Lord, don't you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'马大！马大！你为许多的事思虑烦扰，
verses.en: 'Martha, Martha,' the Lord answered, 'you are worried and upset about many things,

verses.zh: 但是不可少的只有一件；马利亚已经选择那上好的福分，是不能夺去的。'
verses.en: but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.'

verses.zh: 耶稣在一个地方祷告，祷告完了，有一个门徒对他说：'求主教导我们祷告，像约翰教导他的门徒一样。'
verses.en: One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, 'Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们祷告的时候，要说：我们在天上的父，愿人都尊你的名为圣。愿你的国降临。愿你的旨意行在地上，如同行在天上。
verses.en: He said to them, 'When you pray, say: 'Father, hallowed be your name, your kingdom come.

verses.zh: 我们日用的饮食，天天赐给我们。
verses.en: Give us each day our daily bread.

verses.zh: 赦免我们的罪，因为我们也赦免凡亏欠我们的人。不叫我们遇见试探。救我们脱离凶恶。'
verses.en: Forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who sins against us. And lead us not into temptation.''

verses.zh: 他又说：'你们中间谁有一个朋友，半夜到他那里去，说：朋友！请借给我三个饼；
verses.en: Then Jesus said to them, 'Suppose you have a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say, 'Friend, lend me three loaves of bread;

verses.zh: 因为我有一个朋友行路，来到我这里，我没有什么给他摆上。
verses.en: a friend of mine on a journey has come to me, and I have no food to offer him.'

verses.zh: 那人在里面回答说：不要搅扰我，门已经关闭，孩子们也同我在床上了，我不能起来给你。
verses.en: And suppose the one inside answers, 'Don't bother me. The door is already locked, and my children and I are in bed. I can't get up and give you anything.'

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，虽不起身给他，因为是他的朋友，然为他的无耻缠磨，就必起来，照他所需用的给他。
verses.en: I tell you, even though he will not get up and give you the bread because of friendship, yet because of your shameless audacity he will surely get up and give you as much as you need.

verses.zh: 我又告诉你们，你们祈求，就给你们；寻找，就寻见；叩门，就给你们开门。
verses.en: So I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

verses.zh: 因为凡祈求的，就得着；寻找的，就寻见；叩门的，就给他开门。
verses.en: For everyone who asks receives; the one who seeks finds; and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.

verses.zh: 你们中间作父亲的，谁有儿子求饼，反给他石头呢？求鱼，反给他蛇呢？
verses.en: Which of you fathers, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead?

verses.zh: 求鸡蛋，反给他蝎子呢？
verses.en: Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?

verses.zh: 你们虽然不好，尚且知道拿好东西给儿女；何况天父，岂不更将圣灵给求他的人吗？'
verses.en: If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!'

verses.zh: 耶稣赶出一个叫人哑巴的鬼。鬼出去了，哑巴就说出话来；众人都希奇。
verses.en: Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.

verses.zh: 内中却有人说：'他是靠着鬼王别西卜赶鬼。'
verses.en: But some of them said, 'By Beelzebul, the prince of demons, he is driving out demons.'

verses.zh: 又有人试探耶稣，向他求从天上来的神迹。
verses.en: Others tested him by asking for a sign from heaven.

verses.zh: 耶稣知道他们的意念，说：'凡一国自相分争，必至荒凉；一家自相分争，必至败落。
verses.en: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them: 'Any kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and a house divided against itself will fall.

verses.zh: 若撒但自相分争，他的国怎能站得住呢？因为你们说我是靠着别西卜赶鬼。
verses.en: If Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand? I say this because you claim that I drive out demons by Beelzebul.

verses.zh: 我若靠着别西卜赶鬼，你们的子弟赶鬼，又靠着谁呢？这样，他们就要断定你们的是非。
verses.en: Now if I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your followers drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.

verses.zh: 我若靠着神的指头赶鬼，这就是神的国临到你们了。
verses.en: But if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

verses.zh: 壮士披挂整齐，看守自己的住宅，他所有的都平安无事；
verses.en: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are safe.

verses.zh: 但有一个比他更壮的来，胜过他，就夺去他所倚靠的盔甲兵器，又分了他的赃。
verses.en: But when someone stronger attacks and overpowers him, he takes away the armor in which the man trusted and divides up his plunder.

verses.zh: 不与我相合的，就是敌我的；不同我收聚的，就是分散的。'
verses.en: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.

verses.zh: '污鬼离了人身，就在无水之地过来过去，寻求安歇之处；既寻不着，便说：我要回到我所出来的屋里去。
verses.en: 'When an impure spirit comes out of a person, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it. Then it says, 'I will return to the house I left.'

verses.zh: 到了，就看见里面打扫干净，修饰好了，
verses.en: When it arrives, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.

verses.zh: 便去另带了七个比自己更恶的鬼来，都进去住在那里。那人末后的景况，比先前更不好了。'
verses.en: Then it goes and takes seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that person is worse than the first.'

verses.zh: 耶稣正说这话的时候，众人中间有一个女人大声说：'怀你胎的和乳养你的有福了！'
verses.en: As Jesus was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out, 'Blessed is the mother who gave you birth and nursed you!'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'是，却还不如听神之道而遵守的人有福。'
verses.en: He replied, 'Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it.'

verses.zh: 当众人聚集的时候，耶稣开讲说：'这世代是一个邪恶的世代。他们求神迹，除了约拿的神迹以外，再没有神迹给他们。
verses.en: As the crowds increased, Jesus said, 'This is a wicked generation. It asks for a sign, but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah.

verses.zh: 约拿怎样为尼尼微人成了神迹，人子也要照样为这世代的人成了神迹。
verses.en: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so also will the Son of Man be to this generation.

verses.zh: 当审判的时候，南方的女王要起来定这世代的罪，因为她从地极而来，要听所罗门的智慧话；看哪，在这里有一人比所罗门更大。
verses.en: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon's wisdom; and now something greater than Solomon is here.

verses.zh: 当审判的时候，尼尼微人要起来定这世代的罪，因为尼尼微人听了约拿所传的，就悔改了；看哪，在这里有一人比约拿更大。'
verses.en: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and now something greater than Jonah is here.

verses.zh: '没有人点灯放在地窨子或斗底下，乃是放在灯台上，使进来的人得见亮光。
verses.en: 'No one lights a lamp and puts it in a place where it will be hidden, or under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, so that those who come in may see the light.

verses.zh: 你的眼睛就是身上的灯。你的眼睛若了亮，全身就光明；眼睛若昏花，全身就黑暗。
verses.en: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eyes are healthy, your whole body also is full of light. But when they are unhealthy, your body also is full of darkness.

verses.zh: 所以，你要省察，恐怕你里头的光或者黑暗了。
verses.en: See to it, then, that the light within you is not darkness.

verses.zh: 若是你全身光明，毫无黑暗，就必全然光明，如同灯的明光照亮你。'
verses.en: Therefore, if your whole body is full of light, and no part of it dark, it will be just as full of light as when a lamp shines its light on you.'

verses.zh: 说话的时候，有一个法利赛人请耶稣和他吃饭，耶稣就进去坐席。
verses.en: When Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat with him; so he went in and reclined at the table.

verses.zh: 这法利赛人看见耶稣吃饭 beforehand 没有先洗手，便诧异。
verses.en: But the Pharisee was surprised when he noticed that Jesus did not first wash before the meal.

verses.zh: 主对他说：'如今你们法利赛人洗净杯盘的外面，你们里面却满了勒索和邪恶。
verses.en: Then the Lord said to him, 'Now then, you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.

verses.zh: 无知的人哪！造外面的，不也造里面吗？
verses.en: You foolish people! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also?

verses.zh: 只要把里面的施舍给人，凡物于你们就都洁净了。'
verses.en: But now as for what is inside you—be generous to the poor, and everything will be clean for you.

verses.zh: '你们法利赛人有祸了！因为你们将薄荷、芸香并各样菜蔬献上十分之一，那公义和爱神的事反倒不行了。这原是你们当行的，那也是不可不行的。
verses.en: 'Woe to you Pharisees, because you give God a tenth of your mint, rue and all other kinds of garden herbs, but you neglect justice and the love of God. You should have practiced the latter without leaving the former undone.

verses.zh: 你们法利赛人有祸了！因为你们喜爱会堂里的首位，又喜爱人在街市上问你们的安。
verses.en: Woe to you Pharisees, because you love the most important seats in the synagogues and respectful greetings in the marketplaces.

verses.zh: 你们有祸了！因为你们如同不显露的坟墓，走在上面的人并不知道。'
verses.en: Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, which people walk over without knowing it.'

verses.zh: 律法师中有一个回答耶稣说：'夫子！你这样说，也把我们糟蹋了。'
verses.en: One of the experts in the law answered him, 'Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us also.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们律法师也有祸了！因为你们把难担的担子放在人身上，自己一个指头却不肯动。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'And you experts in the law, woe to you, because you load people down with burdens they can hardly carry, and you yourselves will not lift one finger to help them.

verses.zh: 你们有祸了！因为你们修造先知的坟墓，那先知正是你们的祖宗所杀的。
verses.en: Woe to you, because you build tombs for the prophets, and it was your ancestors who killed them.

verses.zh: 可见你们祖宗所作的事，你们又证明又喜欢；因为他们杀了先知，你们修造先知的坟墓。
verses.en: So you testify that you approve of what your ancestors did; they killed the prophets, and you build their tombs.

verses.zh: 所以神用智慧说：我要差遣先知和使徒到他们那里去，有的他们要杀害，有的他们要逼迫，
verses.en: Because of this, God in his wisdom said, 'I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and others they will persecute.'

verses.zh: 使创世以来，所流众先知血的罪，都要问在这世代的人身上，
verses.en: Therefore this generation will be held responsible for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,

verses.zh: 就是从亚伯的血起，直到撒迦利亚的血为止。撒迦利亚死在坛和殿中间。我实在告诉你们，这都要问在这世代的人身上。'
verses.en: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be held responsible for it all.'

verses.zh: '你们律法师有祸了！因为你们把知识的钥匙夺了去，自己不进去，正要进去的人，你们也阻挡他们。'
verses.en: 'Woe to you experts in the law, because you have taken away the key to knowledge. You yourselves have not entered, and you have hindered those who were entering.'

verses.zh: 耶稣从那里出来，文士和法利赛人就极力地催逼他，引动他多说话，
verses.en: When Jesus went outside, the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to oppose him fiercely and to besiege him with questions,

verses.zh: 私下窥听，要拿他的话柄。
verses.en: waiting to catch him in something he might say.

verses.zh: 这时，有几万人聚集，甚至彼此践踏。耶稣开讲，先对门徒说：'你们要防备法利赛人的酵，就是假冒为善。
verses.en: Meanwhile, when a crowd of many thousands had gathered, so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, saying: 'Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

verses.zh: 掩盖的事，没有不露出来的；隐藏的事，没有不被人知道的。
verses.en: There is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.

verses.zh: 因此，你们在暗中所说的，将要在明处被人听见；在屋里私下对人说的，将要在房顶上被人宣扬。'
verses.en: What you have said in the dark will be heard in the daylight, and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed from the roofs.'

verses.zh: '我的朋友，我对你们说，那杀身体以后，不能再作什么的，不要怕他们。
verses.en: 'I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that can do no more.

verses.zh: 我要指示你们当怕的是谁：当怕那杀了以后，又有权柄丢在地狱里的。我实在告诉你们，正要怕他。
verses.en: But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear him who, after your body has been killed, has authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him.

verses.zh: 五个麻雀，不是卖二分银子吗？但在神面前，一个也不忘记。
verses.en: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.

verses.zh: 就是你们的头发，也都被数过了。不要惧怕，你们比许多麻雀还贵重。'
verses.en: Indeed, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Don't be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.'

verses.zh: '我又告诉你们，凡在人面前认我的，人子在神的使者面前也必认他；
verses.en: 'I tell you, whoever publicly acknowledges me before others, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before God's angels.

verses.zh: 在人面前不认我的，人子在神的使者面前也必不认他。
verses.en: But whoever disowns me before others will be disowned before God's angels.

verses.zh: 凡说话干犯人子的，还可得赦免；惟独亵渎圣灵的，总不得赦免。
verses.en: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.zh: 人带你们到会堂，并官府和有权柄的人面前，不要思虑怎么分诉，说什么话；
verses.en: 'When you are brought before synagogues, rulers and authorities, do not worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say,

verses.zh: 因为正在那时候，圣灵要指教你们当说的话。'
verses.en: for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say.'

verses.zh: 众人中有一个人对耶稣说：'夫子！请你吩咐我的兄弟和我分开家业。'
verses.en: Someone in the crowd said to him, 'Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你这个人！谁立我作你们断事的官，给你们分家业呢？'
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'Man, who appointed me a judge or an arbiter between you?'

verses.zh: 于是对众人说：'你们要谨慎自守，免去一切的贪心，因为人的生命不在乎家道丰富。'
verses.en: Then he said to them, 'Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed; life does not consist in an abundance of things.'

verses.zh: 就用比喻对他们说：'有一个富户田产丰收；
verses.en: And he told them this parable: 'The ground of a certain rich man yielded an abundant harvest.

verses.zh: 自己心里思想说：我的出产没有地方收藏，怎么办呢？
verses.en: He thought to himself, 'What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops.'

verses.zh: 又说：我要这么办：要把我的仓房拆了，另盖更大的，在那里好收藏我一切的粮食和财物；
verses.en: Then he said, 'This is what I'll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store my surplus grain and my goods.

verses.zh: 然后要对我的灵魂说：灵魂哪！你有许多财物积存，可作多年的费用，只管安安逸逸地吃喝快乐吧！
verses.en: And I'll say to myself, 'You have plenty of grain laid up for many years. Take life easy; eat, drink and be merry.''

verses.zh: 神却对他说：无知的人哪！今夜必要你的灵魂；你所预备的，要归谁呢？
verses.en: But God said to him, 'You fool! This very night your life will be demanded from you. Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself?'

verses.zh: 凡为自己积财，在神面前却不富足的，也是这样。'
verses.en: This is how it will be with whoever stores up things for themselves but is not rich toward God.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又对门徒说：'所以我告诉你们，不要为生命忧虑吃什么，为身体忧虑穿什么；
verses.en: Then Jesus said to his disciples: 'Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; or about your body, what you will wear.

verses.zh: 因为生命胜于饮食，身体胜于衣裳。
verses.en: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothes.

verses.zh: 你想乌鸦：也不种，也不收，又没有仓，又没有库，神尚且养活它。你们比飞鸟是何等贵重呢！
verses.en: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!

verses.zh: 你们哪一个能用思虑使寿数多加一刻呢？
verses.en: Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to your life?

verses.zh: 这最小的事，你们尚且不能作，为什么还忧虑其余的事呢？
verses.en: Since you cannot do this very little thing, why do you worry about the rest?

verses.zh: 你想百合花怎么长起来：它也不劳苦，也不纺线；然而我告诉你们，就是所罗门极荣华的时候，他所穿戴的，还不如这花一朵呢！
verses.en: Consider how the wild flowers grow. They do not labor or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.

verses.zh: 你们这小信的人哪！野地里的草，今天还在，明天就丢在炉里，神还给它这样的妆饰，何况你们呢！
verses.en: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today, and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, how much more will he clothe you—you of little faith!

verses.zh: 你们不要求吃什么，喝什么，也不要挂心。
verses.en: And do not set your heart on what you will eat or drink; do not worry about it.

verses.zh: 这都是外邦人所求的，你们必须用这些东西，天父是知道的。
verses.en: For the pagan world runs after all such things, and your Father knows that you need them.

verses.zh: 你们只要求他的国，这些东西就必加给你们了。
verses.en: But seek his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.

verses.zh: 你们这小群，不要惧怕，因为你们的父乐意把国赐给你们。
verses.en: Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.

verses.zh: 你们要变卖所有的周济人，要为自己预备永不坏的钱囊，用不尽的财宝在天上，就是贼不能近，虫不能蛀的地方。
verses.en: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out, a treasure in heaven that will never fail, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.

verses.zh: 因为你们的财宝在哪里，你们的心也在那里。'
verses.en: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.'

verses.zh: '你们腰里要束上带子，灯也要点着；
verses.en: 'Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning,

verses.zh: 自己好像仆人等候主人从婚姻的筵席上回来。他来到叩门，就立刻给他开门。
verses.en: like servants waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.

verses.zh: 主人来了，看见仆人警醒，那仆人就有福了。我实在告诉你们，主人必叫他们坐席，自己束上带子来伺候他们。
verses.en: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them watching when he comes. Truly I tell you, he will dress himself to serve, will have them recline at the table and will come and wait on them.

verses.zh: 或是二更天来，或是三更天来，看见仆人这样，那仆人就有福了。
verses.en: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them ready, even if he comes in the middle of the night or toward daybreak.

verses.zh: 你们知道，家主若知道贼什么时候来，就必警醒，不容贼挖透房屋，这是你们所知道的。
verses.en: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.

verses.zh: 你们也要预备，因为你们想不到的时候，人子就来了。'
verses.en: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'主啊！这比喻是为我们说的呢？还是为众人呢？'
verses.en: Peter asked, 'Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everyone?'

verses.zh: 主说：'谁是那忠心有见识的管家，主人派他管理家里的仆人，按时分粮给他们呢？
verses.en: The Lord answered, 'Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time?

verses.zh: 主人来到，看见他这样行，那仆人就有福了。
verses.en: It will be good for that servant whom the master finds doing so when he returns.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，主人要派他管理一切所有的。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

verses.zh: 那仆人若心里说：我的主人必来得迟，就动手打仆人和使女，并且吃喝醉酒；
verses.en: But suppose the servant says to himself, 'My master is taking a long time in coming,' and he then begins to beat the other servants, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk.

verses.zh: 在他想不到的日子，不知道的时辰，那仆人的主人要来，重重地处治他，必把他和不忠心的人同罪。
verses.en: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of. He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unbelievers.

verses.zh: 仆人知道主人的意思，却不预备，又不顺他的意思行，那仆人必多受责打；
verses.en: The servant who knows the master's will and does not get ready or does not do what the master wants will be beaten with many blows.

verses.zh: 惟有那不知道的，作了当受责打的事，必少受责打。因为多给谁，就向谁多取；多托谁，就向谁多要。'
verses.en: But the one who does not know and does things deserving punishment will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded; and from the one who has been entrusted with much, much more will be asked.'

verses.zh: '我来要把火丢在地上，倘若已经着起来，不也是我所愿意的吗？
verses.en: 'I have come to bring fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!

verses.zh: 我有当受的洗还没有成就，我是何等地迫切呢？
verses.en: But I have a baptism to undergo, and what constraint I am under until it is completed!

verses.zh: 你们以为我来，是叫地上太平吗？我告诉你们，不是，乃是叫人纷争。
verses.en: Do you think I came to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but division.

verses.zh: 从今以后，一家五个人将要纷争：三个人和两个人相争，两个人和三个人相争；
verses.en: From now on there will be five in one family divided against each other, three against two and two against three.

verses.zh: 父亲和儿子相争，儿子和父亲相争；母亲和女儿相争，女儿和母亲相争；婆婆和媳妇相争，媳妇和婆婆相争。'
verses.en: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又对众人说：'你们看见南边起了云彩，就说：要下雨了，果然如此；
verses.en: He said to the crowd: 'When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, 'It's going to rain,' and it does.

verses.zh: 起了南风，就说：要热了，果然如此。
verses.en: And when the south wind blows, you say, 'It's going to be hot,' and it is.

verses.zh: 假冒为善的人哪！你们知道分辨天地的气色，怎么不知道分辨这时候呢？'
verses.en: Hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky. How is it that you don't know how to interpret this present time?

verses.zh: '你们为什么不自己审量什么是合理的呢？
verses.en: 'Why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?

verses.zh: 你同告你的对头去见官的时候，务要在路上设法和他了结，免得他拉你到官面前，官交付差役，差役把你下在监里。
verses.en: As you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, try hard to be reconciled on the way, or your adversary may drag you off to the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

verses.zh: 我告诉你，若有半文钱没有还清，你断不能从那里出来。'
verses.en: I tell you, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny.'

verses.zh: 正当那时，有人将彼拉多使加利利人流血掺杂在他们祭物中的事告诉耶稣。
verses.en: Now there were some present at that time who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们以为这些加利利人比众加利利人更有罪，所以受这害吗？
verses.en: Jesus answered, 'Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans because they suffered this way?

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，不是的！你们若不悔改，都要如此灭亡。
verses.en: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.

verses.zh: 从前西罗亚楼倒塌了，压死十八个人，你们以为那些人比一切住在耶路撒冷的人更有罪吗？
verses.en: Or those eighteen who died when the tower in Siloam fell on them—do you think they were more guilty than all the others living in Jerusalem?

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，不是的！你们若不悔改，都要如此灭亡。'
verses.en: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.'

verses.zh: 于是用比喻说：'一个人有一棵无花果树，栽在葡萄园里。他来找果子，却找不着。
verses.en: Then he told this parable: 'A man had a fig tree growing in his vineyard, and he went to look for fruit on it but did not find any.

verses.zh: 就对管园的说：我在这树旁找果子，已经三年了，竟找不着，把它砍了吧，何必白占地土呢！
verses.en: So he said to the man who took care of the vineyard, 'For three years now I've been coming to look for fruit on this fig tree and haven't found any. Cut it down! Why should it use up the soil?'

verses.zh: 管园的说：主人啊，今年且留着吧，等我周围掘开土，加上粪；
verses.en: Sir,' the man replied, 'leave it alone for one more year, and I'll dig around it and fertilize it.

verses.zh: 以后若结果子便罢，不然再把它砍了。'
verses.en: If it bears fruit next year, fine! If not, then cut it down.''

verses.zh: 安息日，耶稣在会堂里教训人。
verses.en: On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,

verses.zh: 有一个女人，被鬼附着病了十八年，腰弯得一点直不起来。
verses.en: and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.

verses.zh: 耶稣看见，便叫过她来，对她说：'女人，你脱离这病了！'
verses.en: When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her, 'Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.'

verses.zh: 于是用两只手按着她，她立刻直起腰来，就归荣耀与神。
verses.en: Then he put his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.

verses.zh: 管会堂的因为耶稣在安息日治病，就气忿忿地对众人说：'有六日应当作工，那六日之内可以来求医，在安息日却不可。'
verses.en: Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, the synagogue leader said to the people, 'There are six days for work. So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath.'

verses.zh: 主说：'假冒为善的人哪！难道你们各人在安息日不解开槽上的牛驴，牵去饮水吗？
verses.en: The Lord answered him, 'You hypocrites! Doesn't each of you on the Sabbath untie your ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?

verses.zh: 况且这女人本是亚伯拉罕的后裔，被撒但捆绑了这十八年，不当在安息日解开她的绑吗？'
verses.en: Then should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说这话，他的敌人都惭愧了；众人因他所行一切荣耀的事，就都欢喜。
verses.en: When he said this, all his opponents were humiliated, but the people were delighted with all the wonderful things he was doing.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'神的国好像什么？我拿什么来比较呢？
verses.en: Then Jesus asked, 'What is the kingdom of God like? What shall I compare it to?

verses.zh: 好像一粒芥菜种，有人拿去种在园子里，长大成树，天上的飞鸟宿在它的枝上。'
verses.en: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds perched in its branches.'

verses.zh: 又说：'我拿什么来比神的国呢？
verses.en: Again he asked, 'What shall I compare the kingdom of God to?

verses.zh: 好比面酵，有妇人拿来藏在三斗面里，直等全团都发起来。'
verses.en: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into about sixty pounds of flour until it worked all through the dough.'

verses.zh: 耶稣往耶路撒冷去，在所经过的各城各乡教训人。
verses.en: Then Jesus went through the towns and villages, teaching as he made his way to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 有一个人问他说：'主啊，得救的人少吗？'
verses.en: Someone asked him, 'Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对众人说：'你们要努力进窄门。我告诉你们，将来有许多人想要进去，却是不能。
verses.en: He said to them, 'Make every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.

verses.zh: 及至家主起来关了门，你们站在外面叩门，说：主啊，给我们开门，他就回答说：我不认识你们，不晓得你们是哪里来的。
verses.en: Once the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you will stand outside knocking and pleading, 'Sir, open the door for us.' But he will answer, 'I don't know you or where you come from.'

verses.zh: 那时，你们要说：我们在你面前吃过喝过，你也在我们的街上教训过人。
verses.en: Then you will say, 'We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.'

verses.zh: 他要说：我告诉你们，我不认识你们，不晓得你们是哪里来的。你们这一切作恶的人，离开我去吧！
verses.en: But he will reply, 'I don't know you or where you come from. Away from me, all you evildoers!'

verses.zh: 你们要看见亚伯拉罕、以撒、雅各，和众先知都在神的国里，你们却被赶到外面，在那里必要哀哭切齿了。
verses.en: There will be weeping there, and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown out.

verses.zh: 又有从东、从西、从南、从北来的，要在神的国里坐席。
verses.en: People will come from east and west and north and south, and will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of God.

verses.zh: 只是有在后的，将要在前；有在前的，将要在后。'
verses.en: Indeed there are those who are last who will be first, and first who will be last.'

verses.zh: 正当那时，有几个法利赛人来对耶稣说：'离开这里去吧，因为希律想要杀你。'
verses.en: At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said to him, 'Leave this place and go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们去告诉那个狐狸说：今天明天我赶鬼治病，第三天我的事就成全了。
verses.en: He replied, 'Go tell that fox, 'I will keep on driving out demons and healing people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.'

verses.zh: 虽然这样，今天明天后天，我必须前行，因为先知在耶路撒冷之外丧命是不能的。
verses.en: In any case, I must press on today and tomorrow and the next day—for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem!

verses.zh: 耶路撒冷啊！耶路撒冷啊！你常杀害先知，又用石头打死那奉差遣到你这里来的人。我多次愿意聚集你的儿女，好像母鸡把小鸡聚集在翅膀底下，只是你们不愿意。
verses.en: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.

verses.zh: 看哪，你们的家成为荒场留给你们。我告诉你们，从今以后，你们不得再见我，直等到你们说：奉主名来的是应当称颂的！'
verses.en: Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.''

verses.zh: 在安息日，耶稣到一个法利赛人的首领家里去吃饭，他们就窥探他。
verses.en: One Sabbath, when Jesus went to eat in the house of a prominent Pharisee, he was being carefully watched.

verses.zh: 在他面前有一个患水臌的人。
verses.en: There in front of him was a man suffering from abnormal swelling of his body.

verses.zh: 耶稣对律法师和法利赛人说：'安息日治病可以不可以？'
verses.en: Jesus asked the Pharisees and experts in the law, 'Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?'

verses.zh: 他们却不言语。耶稣就治好了那人，叫他走了。
verses.en: But they remained silent. So taking hold of the man, he healed him and sent him on his way.

verses.zh: 便对他们说：'你们中间谁有驴或牛在安息日掉在井里，不立时拉它上来呢？'
verses.en: Then he asked them, 'If one of you has a child or an ox that falls into a well on the Sabbath day, will you not immediately pull it out?'

verses.zh: 他们不能对答这话。
verses.en: They had nothing to say.

verses.zh: 耶稣见所请的客拣择首位，就用比喻对他们说：
verses.en: When he noticed how the guests picked the places of honor at the table, he told them this parable:

verses.zh: '你被人请去赴婚姻的筵席，不要坐在首位，恐怕有比你尊贵的客被他请来；
verses.en: 'When someone invites you to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, for a person more distinguished than you may have been invited.

verses.zh: 那请你们的主人来对你们说：让座给这一位吧！你就羞羞惭惭地退到末位上去了。
verses.en: If so, the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, 'Give this person your seat.' Then, humiliated, you will have to take the least important place.

verses.zh: 你被请的时候，就去坐在末位上，好叫那请你的人来对你们说：朋友，请上坐。这在你面前就有荣耀了。
verses.en: But when you are invited, take the lowest place, so that when your host comes, he will say to you, 'Friend, move up to a better place.' Then you will be honored in the presence of all the other guests.

verses.zh: 因为凡自高的，必降为卑；自卑的，必升为高。'
verses.en: For all those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又对请他的人说：'你摆设午饭或晚饭，不要请你的朋友、弟兄、本族的人，和富足的邻舍，恐怕他们也请你，你就得了报答。
verses.en: Then Jesus said to his host, 'When you give a luncheon or dinner, do not invite your friends, your brothers or sisters, your relatives, or your rich neighbors; if you do, they may invite you back and so you will be repaid.

verses.zh: 你摆设筵席的时候，要请那贫穷的、残废的、瘸腿的、瞎眼的，你就有福了！
verses.en: But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,

verses.zh: 因为他们没有可报答你的。到义人复活的时候，你要得着报答。'
verses.en: and you will be blessed. Although they cannot repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.'

verses.zh: 同席的有一个听见这话，就对耶稣说：'在神国里吃饭的有福了！'
verses.en: When one of those at the table with him heard this, he said to Jesus, 'Blessed is the one who will eat at the feast in the kingdom of God.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'有一个人摆设大筵席，请了许多客。
verses.en: Jesus replied: 'A certain man was preparing a great banquet and invited many guests.

verses.zh: 到了坐席的时候，打发仆人去对所请的人说：请来吧！因为都齐备了。
verses.en: At the time of the banquet he sent his servant to tell those who had been invited, 'Come, for everything is now ready.'

verses.zh: 众人一口同音地推辞。头一个说：我买了一块地，必须去看看。请你准我辞了。
verses.en: But they all alike began to make excuses. The first said, 'I have just bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please excuse me.'

verses.zh: 又有一个说：我买了五对牛，要去试一试。请你准我辞了。
verses.en: Another said, 'I have just bought five yoke of oxen, and I'm on my way to try them out. Please excuse me.'

verses.zh: 又有一个说：我才娶了妻，所以不能去。
verses.en: Still another said, 'I just got married, so I can't come.'

verses.zh: 那仆人回来，把这事都告诉了主人。家主就恼怒，对仆人说：快出去到城里大街小巷，领那贫穷的、残废的、瞎眼的、瘸腿的来。
verses.en: The servant came back and reported this to his master. Then the owner of the house became angry and ordered his servant, 'Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind and the lame.'

verses.zh: 仆人说：主啊，你所吩咐的已经办了，还有空座。
verses.en: Sir,' the servant said, 'what you ordered has been done, but there is still room.'

verses.zh: 主人对仆人说：你出去到路上和篱笆那里，勉强人进来，坐满我的屋子。
verses.en: Then the master told his servant, 'Go out to the roads and country lanes and compel them to come in, so that my house will be full.

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，先前所请的人，没有一个得尝我的筵席。'
verses.en: I tell you, not one of those who were invited will get a taste of my dinner.''

verses.zh: 有极多的人和耶稣同行。他转过来对他们说：
verses.en: Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and turning to them he said:

verses.zh: '人到我这里来，若不爱我胜过爱自己的父母、妻子、儿女、弟兄、姐妹，和自己的性命，就不能作我的门徒。
verses.en: 'If anyone comes to me and does not hate father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters—yes, even their own life—such a person cannot be my disciple.

verses.zh: 凡不背着自己十字架跟从我的，也不能作我的门徒。
verses.en: And whoever does not carry their cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.

verses.zh: 你们哪一个要盖一座楼，不先坐下算计花费，能盖成不能呢？
verses.en: Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Won't you first sit down and estimate the cost to see if you have enough money to complete it?

verses.zh: 恐怕安了地基，不能成功，看见的人都笑话他，
verses.en: For if you lay the foundation and are not able to finish it, everyone who sees it will ridicule you,

verses.zh: 说：这个人开了工，却不能完工。
verses.en: saying, 'This person began to build and wasn't able to finish.'

verses.zh: 或是一个王出去和别的王打仗，岂不先坐下酌量，能用一万兵去敌那领二万兵的吗？
verses.en: Or suppose a king is about to go to war against another king. Won't he first sit down and consider whether he is able with ten thousand men to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand?

verses.zh: 若是不能，就趁敌人还远的时候，派使者去求和的条款。
verses.en: If he is not able, he will send a delegation while the other is still a long way off and will ask for terms of peace.

verses.zh: 这样，你们无论什么人，若不撇下一切所有的，就不能作我的门徒。'
verses.en: In the same way, those of you who do not give up everything you have cannot be my disciple.'

verses.zh: '盐本是好的；盐若失了味，可用什么叫它再咸呢？
verses.en: 'Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again?

verses.zh: 或用在田里，或堆在粪里，都不合适，只好丢在外面。有耳可听的，就应当听！'
verses.en: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile; it is thrown out. Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.''

verses.zh: 众税吏和罪人都挨近耶稣，要听他讲道。
verses.en: Now the tax collectors and sinners were all gathering around to hear Jesus.

verses.zh: 法利赛人和文士私下议论说：'这个人接待罪人，又同他们吃饭。'
verses.en: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law muttered, 'This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就用比喻对他们说：
verses.en: Then Jesus told them this parable:

verses.zh: '你们中间谁有一百只羊失去一只，不把这九十九只撇在旷野，去找那失去的羊直到找着呢？
verses.en: 'Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep and loses one of them. Doesn't he leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost sheep until he finds it?

verses.zh: 找着了，就欢欢喜喜地扛在肩上，回到家里，
verses.en: And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders

verses.zh: 请朋友邻舍来，对他们说：我失去的羊已经找着了，你们和我一同欢喜吧！
verses.en: and goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbors together and says, 'Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep.'

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，一个罪人悔改，在天上也要这样为他欢喜，较比为九十九个不用悔改的义人欢喜更大。'
verses.en: I tell you that in the same way there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent.'

verses.zh: '或是一个妇人有十块钱，若失落一块，岂不点上灯，打扫屋子，细细地找，直到找着呢？
verses.en: 'Or suppose a woman has ten silver coins and loses one. Doesn't she light a lamp, sweep the house and search carefully until she finds it?

verses.zh: 找着了，就请朋友邻舍来，对他们说：我失落的那块钱已经找着了，你们和我一同欢喜吧！
verses.en: And when she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, 'Rejoice with me; I have found my lost coin.'

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，一个罪人悔改，在神的使者面前也是这样为他欢喜。'
verses.en: In the same way, I tell you, there is rejoicing in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又说：'一个人有两个儿子。
verses.en: Jesus continued: 'There was a man who had two sons.

verses.zh: 小儿子对父亲说：父亲，请你把我应得的家业分给我。他父亲就把产业分给他们。
verses.en: The younger one said to his father, 'Father, give me my share of the estate.' So he divided his property between them.

verses.zh: 过了不多几日，小儿子就把他一切所有的都收拾起来，往远方去了。在那里任意放荡，浪费资财。
verses.en: Not long after that, the younger son got together all he had, set off for a distant country and there squandered his wealth in wild living.

verses.zh: 既耗尽了一切所有的，又遇着那地方大遭饥荒，就穷苦起来。
verses.en: After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that whole country, and he began to be in need.

verses.zh: 于是去投靠那地方的一个人，那人打发他到田里去放猪。
verses.en: So he went and hired himself out to a citizen of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.

verses.zh: 他恨不得拿猪所吃的豆荚充饥，也没有人给他。
verses.en: He longed to fill his stomach with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.

verses.zh: 他醒悟过来，就说：我父亲有多少的雇工，口粮有余，我倒在这里饿死吗？
verses.en: When he came to his senses, he said, 'How many of my father's hired servants have food to spare, and here I am starving to death!

verses.zh: 我要起来，到我父亲那里去，对他说：父亲！我得罪了天，又得罪了你；
verses.en: I will set out and go back to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

verses.zh: 从今以后，我不配称为你的儿子，把我当作一个雇工吧！
verses.en: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; make me like one of your hired servants.''

verses.zh: 于是起来，往他父亲那里去。相离还远，他父亲看见，就动了慈心，跑去抱着他的颈项，连连与他亲嘴。
verses.en: So he got up and went to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion for him; he ran to his son, threw his arms around him and kissed him.

verses.zh: 儿子说：父亲！我得罪了天，又得罪了你；从今以后，我不配称为你的儿子。
verses.en: The son said to him, 'Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.'

verses.zh: 父亲却吩咐仆人说：把那上好的袍子快拿出来给他穿；把戒指戴在他指头上；把鞋穿在他脚上；
verses.en: But the father said to his servants, 'Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

verses.zh: 把那肥牛犊牵来宰了，我们可以吃喝快乐；
verses.en: Bring the fattened calf and kill it. Let's have a feast and celebrate.

verses.zh: 因为我这个儿子是死而复活，失而又得的。他们就快乐起来。
verses.en: For this son of mine was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.' So they began to celebrate.

verses.zh: 那时，大儿子正在田里。他回来，离家不远，听见作乐跳舞的声音，
verses.en: Meanwhile, the older son was in the field. When he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.

verses.zh: 便叫过一个仆人来，问是什么事。
verses.en: So he called one of the servants and asked him what was going on.

verses.zh: 仆人说：你兄弟来了，你父亲因为得他无灾无病地回来，把肥牛犊宰了。
verses.en: Your brother has come,' he replied, 'and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound.'

verses.zh: 大儿子就生气，不肯进去。他父亲就出来劝他。
verses.en: The older brother became angry and refused to go in. So his father went out and pleaded with him.

verses.zh: 他对父亲说：我服侍你这多年，从来没有违背过你的命，你并没有给我一只山羊羔，叫我和朋友一同快乐。
verses.en: But he answered his father, 'Look! All these years I've been slaving for you and never disobeyed your orders. Yet you never gave me even a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.

verses.zh: 但你这个儿子和娼妓吞尽了你的产业，他一来了，你倒为他宰了肥牛犊。
verses.en: But when this son of yours who has squandered your property with prostitutes comes home, you kill the fattened calf for him!'

verses.zh: 父亲对他说：儿啊！你常和我同在，我一切所有的都是你的；
verses.en: My son,' the father said, 'you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.

verses.zh: 只因你这个兄弟是死而复活，失而又得的，所以我们理当欢喜快乐。'
verses.en: But we had to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.''

verses.zh: 耶稣又对门徒说：'有一个财主的管家，主人控告他浪费主人的财物。
verses.en: Jesus told his disciples: 'There was a rich man whose manager was accused of wasting his possessions.

verses.zh: 主人叫他来，对他说：我听见你的事，你给我交代清楚，因为你不能再作我的管家了。'
verses.en: So he called him in and asked him, 'What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your management, because you cannot be manager any longer.''

verses.zh: 那管家心里说：主人辞我，我将来做什么呢？锄地呢？我没有力气；讨饭呢？我怕羞。
verses.en: The manager said to himself, 'What shall I do now? My master is taking away my job. I'm not strong enough to dig, and I'm ashamed to beg—

verses.zh: 我知道怎么行，好叫人在我被辞之后，接我到他们家里去。
verses.en: I know what I'll do so that, when I lose my job here, people will welcome me into their houses.'

verses.zh: 于是把欠他主人债的，一个一个地叫了来，问头一个说：你欠我主人多少？
verses.en: So he called in each one of his master's debtors. He asked the first, 'How much do you owe my master?'

verses.zh: 他说：一百篓油。他说：拿你的账，坐下，赶快写五十。
verses.en: 'Eight hundred gallons of olive oil,' he replied. The manager told him, 'Take your bill, sit down quickly, and make it four hundred.'

verses.zh: 又问第二个说：你欠多少？他说：一百石麦子。他说：拿你的账，写八十。
verses.en: Then he asked the second, 'And how much do you owe?' 'A thousand bushels of wheat,' he replied. He told him, 'Take your bill and make it eight hundred.'

verses.zh: 主人就夸奖这不义的管家作事聪明。因为今世之子，在世事之上，较比光明之子更加聪明。
verses.en: The master commended the dishonest manager because he had acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own kind than are the people of the light.

verses.zh: 我又告诉你们，要藉着那不义的钱财，结交朋友，到了钱财无用的时候，他们可以接你们到永存的帐幕里去。
verses.en: I tell you, use worldly wealth to gain friends for yourselves, so that when it is gone, you will be welcomed into eternal dwellings.

verses.zh: 人在最小的事上忠心，在大事上也忠心；在最小的事上不义，在大事上也不义。
verses.en: Whoever can be trusted with very little can also be trusted with much, and whoever is dishonest with very little will also be dishonest with much.

verses.zh: 倘若你们在不义的钱财上不忠心，谁还把那真实的钱财托付你们呢？
verses.en: So if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?

verses.zh: 倘若你们在别人的东西上不忠心，谁还把你们自己的东西给你们呢？
verses.en: And if you have not been trustworthy with someone else's property, who will give you property of your own?

verses.zh: 一个仆人不能侍奉两个主人；不是恶这个爱那个，就是重这个轻那个。你们不能又侍奉神，又侍奉玛门。'
verses.en: No one can serve two masters. Either you will hate the one and love the other, or you will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money.'

verses.zh: 法利赛人是贪爱钱财的，他们听见这一切话，就嗤笑耶稣。
verses.en: The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and were sneering at Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'你们是在人面前自称为义的，你们的心，神却知道；因为人所尊贵的，是神看为可憎恶的。
verses.en: He said to them, 'You are the ones who justify yourselves in the eyes of others, but God knows your hearts. What people value highly is detestable in God's sight.'

verses.zh: 律法和先知，到约翰为止；从此，神国的福音传开了，人人努力要进去。
verses.en: The Law and the Prophets were proclaimed until John. Since that time, the good news of the kingdom of God is being preached, and everyone is forcing their way into it.

verses.zh: 天地废去，较比律法的一点一画落空还容易。
verses.en: It is easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for the least stroke of a pen to drop out of the Law.

verses.zh: 凡休妻另娶的，就是犯奸淫；娶被休之妻的，也是犯奸淫。'
verses.en: Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.'

verses.zh: '有一个财主，穿着紫色袍和细麻布衣服，天天奢华宴乐。
verses.en: 'There was a rich man who was dressed in purple and fine linen and lived in luxury every day.

verses.zh: 又有一个讨饭的，名叫拉撒路，浑身生疮，被人放在财主门口，
verses.en: At his gate was laid a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores

verses.zh: 要得财主桌子上掉下来的零碎充饥，并且狗来舔他的疮。
verses.en: and longing to eat what fell from the rich man's table. Even the dogs came and licked his sores.

verses.zh: 后来那讨饭的死了，被天使带去放在亚伯拉罕的怀里。财主也死了，并且埋葬了。
verses.en: The time came when the beggar died and the angels carried him to Abraham's side. The rich man also died and was buried.

verses.zh: 他在阴间受痛苦，举目远远地望见亚伯拉罕，又望见拉撒路在他怀里，
verses.en: In Hades, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far away, with Lazarus by his side.

verses.zh: 就喊着说：我祖亚伯拉罕哪，可怜我吧！打发拉撒路来，用指头尖蘸点水，凉凉我的舌头，因为我在这火焰里，极其痛苦。
verses.en: So he called to him, 'Father Abraham, have pity on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in agony in this fire.'

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕说：儿啊，你该回想你生前享过福，拉撒路也受过苦；如今他在这里得安慰，你倒受痛苦。
verses.en: But Abraham replied, 'Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, while Lazarus received bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in agony.

verses.zh: 不但这样，并且在你我之间，有深渊限定，以致人要从这边过到你们那边，是不能的；要从那边过到我们这边，也是不能的。
verses.en: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been set in place, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.'

verses.zh: 财主说：我祖啊！既是这样，求你打发拉撒路到我父家去，
verses.en: He answered, 'Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my family,

verses.zh: 因为我还有五个弟兄，他可以对他们作见证，免得他们也来到这痛苦的地方。
verses.en: for I have five brothers. Let him warn them, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.'

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕说：他们有摩西和先知的话，可以听从。
verses.en: Abraham replied, 'They have Moses and the Prophets; let them listen to them.'

verses.zh: 他说：我祖亚伯拉罕哪，不是的，若有一个从死里复活的，到他们那里去的，他们必要悔改。
verses.en: No, father Abraham,' he said, 'but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.'

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕说：若不听从摩西和先知的话，就是有一个从死里复活的，他们也是不听劝。'
verses.en: He said to him, 'If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.''

verses.zh: 耶稣又对门徒说：'绊倒人的事是免不了的，但那绊倒人的有祸了！
verses.en: Jesus said to his disciples: 'Things that cause people to stumble are bound to come, but woe to anyone through whom they come.

verses.zh: 就是把磨石拴在这人的颈项上，丢在海里，还强如他把这小子里的一个绊倒了。
verses.en: It would be better for them to be thrown into the sea with a millstone tied around their neck than to cause one of these little ones to stumble.

verses.zh: 你们要谨慎。若是你的弟兄得罪你，就劝戒他；他若懊悔，就饶恕他。
verses.en: So watch yourselves. If your brother or sister sins against you, rebuke them; and if they repent, forgive them.

verses.zh: 倘若他一天七次得罪你，又七次回转，说：我懊悔了，你总要饶恕他。'
verses.en: Even if they sin against you seven times in a day and seven times come back to you saying 'I repent,' you must forgive them.'

verses.zh: 使徒对主说：'求主加增我们的信心！'
verses.en: The apostles said to the Lord, 'Increase our faith!'

verses.zh: 主说：'你们若有信心像一粒芥菜种，就是对这棵桑树说：你要连根拔起，栽在海里，它也必听从你们。
verses.en: He replied, 'If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, 'Be uprooted and planted in the sea,' and it will obey you.

verses.zh: 你们谁有仆人耕地，或是放羊，从田里回来，就对他说：你快来坐下吃饭呢？
verses.en: Suppose one of you has a servant plowing or looking after the sheep. Will he say to the servant when he comes in from the field, 'Come along now and sit down to eat'?

verses.zh: 岂不对他说：你给我预备晚饭，束上带子伺候我，等我吃喝完了，你才可以吃喝吗？
verses.en: Won't he rather say, 'Prepare my supper, get yourself ready and wait on me while I eat and drink; after that you may eat and drink'?

verses.zh: 仆人照着所吩咐的去作，主人还谢谢他吗？
verses.en: Will he thank the servant because he did what he was told to do?

verses.zh: 这样，你们作完了一切所吩咐的，只当说：我们是无用的仆人，所作的本是我们应分作的。'
verses.en: So you also, when you have done everything you were told to do, should say, 'We are unworthy servants; we have only done our duty.''

verses.zh: 耶稣往耶路撒冷去，经过撒玛利亚和加利利。
verses.en: Now on his way to Jerusalem, Jesus traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

verses.zh: 进入一个村子，有十个长大麻风的，迎面而来，远远地站着，
verses.en: As he was going into a village, ten men who had leprosy met him. They stood at a distance

verses.zh: 高声说：'耶稣，夫子，可怜我们吧！'
verses.en: and called out in a loud voice, 'Jesus, Master, have pity on us!'

verses.zh: 耶稣看见，就对他们说：'你们去，把身体给祭司察看。'他们去的时候，就洁净了。
verses.en: When he saw them, he said, 'Go, show yourselves to the priests.' And as they went, they were cleansed.

verses.zh: 内中有一个见自己已经好了，就回来大声归荣耀与神，
verses.en: One of them, when he saw he was healed, came back, praising God in a loud voice.

verses.zh: 又俯伏在耶稣脚前感谢他。这人是撒玛利亚人。
verses.en: He threw himself at Jesus' feet and thanked him—and he was a Samaritan.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'洁净了的不是十个人吗？那九个在哪里呢？
verses.en: Jesus asked, 'Were not all ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?

verses.zh: 除了这外族人，再没有别人回来归荣耀与神吗？'
verses.en: Has no one returned to give praise to God except this foreigner?'

verses.zh: 就对那人说：'起来，走吧！你的信救了你了。'
verses.en: Then he said to him, 'Rise and go; your faith has made you well.''

verses.zh: 法利赛人问：'神的国几时来到？'耶稣回答说：'神的国来到，不是眼所能见的；
verses.en: Once, on being asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, Jesus replied, 'The coming of the kingdom of God is not something that can be observed,

verses.zh: 人也不得说：看哪，在这里；看哪，在那里。因为神的国就在你们心里。'
verses.en: nor will people say, 'Here it is,' or 'There it is,' because the kingdom of God is in your midst.'

verses.zh: 他对门徒说：'日子将到，你们巴不得看见人子的一个日子，却不得看见。
verses.en: Then he said to his disciples, 'The time is coming when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.

verses.zh: 人将要对你们说：看哪，在那里；看哪，在这里。你们不要出去，也不要跟随他们。
verses.en: People will tell you, 'There he is!' or 'Here he is!' Do not go running off after them.

verses.zh: 因为人子在他降临的日子，好像闪电从天这边一闪，直照到天那边。
verses.en: For the Son of Man in his day will be like the lightning, which flashes and lights up the sky from one end to the other.

verses.zh: 只是他必须先受许多苦，又被这世代弃绝。
verses.en: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

verses.zh: 挪亚的日子怎样，人子的日子也要怎样。
verses.en: Just as it was in the days of Noah, so also will it be in the days of the Son of Man.

verses.zh: 那时候的人又吃又喝，又娶又嫁，到挪亚进方舟的那日，洪水就来，把他们全都灭了。
verses.en: People were eating, drinking, marrying and being given in marriage up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.

verses.zh: 又好像罗得的日子，人又吃又喝，又买又卖，又耕种又盖造。
verses.en: It was the same in the days of Lot. People were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.

verses.zh: 到罗得出所多玛的那日，就有火与硫磺从天上降下来，把他们全都灭了。
verses.en: But the day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.

verses.zh: 人子显现的日子，也要这样。
verses.en: It will be just like this on the day the Son of Man is revealed.

verses.zh: 当那日，人在房上，器具在屋里，不要下来拿；人在田里，也不要回家。
verses.en: On that day no one who is on the housetop, with possessions inside, should go down to get them. Likewise, no one in the field should go back for anything.

verses.zh: 你们要回想罗得的妻子。
verses.en: Remember Lot's wife!

verses.zh: 凡想要保全生命的，必丧掉生命；凡丧掉生命的，必救活生命。
verses.en: Whoever tries to keep their life will lose it, and whoever loses their life will preserve it.

verses.zh: 我对你们说：当那一夜，两个人在一个床上，要取去一个，撇下一个。
verses.en: I tell you, on that night two people will be in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.

verses.zh: 两个女人一同推磨，要取去一个，撇下一个。'
verses.en: Two women will be grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left.'

verses.zh: 有两个人在田里，要取去一个，撇下一个。'
verses.en: Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.'

verses.zh: 门徒说：'主啊！在哪里有这事呢？'耶稣说：'尸首在哪里，鹰也必聚在那里。'
verses.en: Where, Lord?' they asked. He replied, 'Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather.''

verses.zh: 耶稣设一个比喻，是要人常常祷告，不可灰心。
verses.en: Then Jesus told his disciples a parable to show them that they should always pray and not give up.

verses.zh: 说：'某城里有一个官，不惧怕神，也不尊重人。
verses.en: He said: 'In a certain town there was a judge who neither feared God nor cared what people thought.

verses.zh: 那城里有一个寡妇，常到他那里，说：我有一个对头，求你给我伸冤。
verses.en: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, 'Grant me justice against my adversary.''

verses.zh: 他多日不准，后来心里说：我虽不惧怕神，也不尊重人，
verses.en: For some time he refused. But finally he said to himself, 'Even though I don't fear God or care what people think,

verses.zh: 只因这寡妇烦扰我，我就给她伸冤吧，免得她常来缠磨我。'
verses.en: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will see that she gets justice, so that she won't eventually come and attack me!''

verses.zh: 主说：'你们听这不义之官所说的话。
verses.en: And the Lord said, 'Listen to what the unjust judge says.

verses.zh: 神的选民昼夜呼吁他，他纵然为他们忍了多时，岂不终久给他们伸冤吗？我告诉你们，要快快地给他们伸冤了。
verses.en: And will not God bring about justice for his chosen ones, who cry out to him day and night? Will he keep putting them off?

verses.zh: 然而，人子来的时候，遇得见世上有信德吗？'
verses.en: I tell you, he will see that they get justice, and quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?'

verses.zh: 耶稣向那些仗着自己是义人，藐视别人的，设一个比喻，
verses.en: To some who were confident of their own righteousness and looked down on everyone else, Jesus told this parable:

verses.zh: 说：'有两个人上殿里去祷告：一个是法利赛人，一个是税吏。
verses.en: 'Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.

verses.zh: 法利赛人站着，自言自语地祷告说：神啊！我感谢你，我不像别人勒索、不义、奸淫，也不像这个税吏。
verses.en: The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed: 'God, I thank you that I am not like other people—robbers, evildoers, adulterers—or even like this tax collector.

verses.zh: 我一个礼拜禁食两次，凡我所得的，都捐上十分之一。
verses.en: I fast twice a week and give a tenth of all I get.'

verses.zh: 那税吏远远地站着，连举目望天也不敢，只捶着胸说：神啊，开恩可怜我这个罪人！
verses.en: But the tax collector stood at a distance. He would not even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, 'God, have mercy on me, a sinner.'

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，这人回家去，比那人倒算为义了。因为凡自高的，必降为卑；自卑的，必升为高。'
verses.en: I tell you that this man, rather than the other, went home justified before God. For all those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.'

verses.zh: 有人抱着自己的婴孩来见耶稣，要他摸他们；门徒看见就责备那些人。
verses.en: People were also bringing babies to Jesus for him to place his hands on them. When the disciples saw this, they rebuked them.

verses.zh: 耶稣却叫他们来，说：'让小孩子到我这里来，不要禁止他们，因为在神国的，正是这样的人。
verses.en: But Jesus called the children to him and said, 'Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，凡要承受神国的，若不像小孩子，断不能进去。'
verses.en: Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.'

verses.zh: 有一个官问耶稣说：'良善的夫子，我当做什么事，才可以承受永生？'
verses.en: A certain ruler asked him, 'Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'你为什么称我是良善的？除了神一位之外，再没有良善的。
verses.en: Why do you call me good?' Jesus answered. 'No one is good—except God alone.

verses.zh: 诫命你是晓得的：不可奸淫，不可杀人，不可偷盗，不可作假见证，当孝敬父母。'
verses.en: You know the commandments: 'You shall not commit adultery, you shall not murder, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.''

verses.zh: 那人说：'这一切我从小都遵守了。'
verses.en: All these I have kept since I was a boy,' he said.

verses.zh: 耶稣听见了，就说：'你还缺少一件：要变卖你一切所有的，分给穷人，就必有财宝在天上；你还要来跟从我。'
verses.en: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, 'You still lack one thing. Sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.'

verses.zh: 他听见这话，就甚忧愁，因为他很富足。
verses.en: When he heard this, he became very sad, because he was very wealthy.

verses.zh: 耶稣看见他，就说：'有钱财的人进神的国，是何等的难哪！
verses.en: Jesus looked at him and said, 'How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!

verses.zh: 骆驼穿过针的眼，比财主进神的国，还容易呢！'
verses.en: Indeed, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.'

verses.zh: 听见的人说：'这样，谁能得救呢？'
verses.en: Those who heard this asked, 'Who then can be saved?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'在人所不能的事，在神却能。'
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'What is impossible with man is possible with God.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'看哪，我们已经撇下自己所有的，跟从你了。'
verses.en: Peter said to him, 'We have left all we had to follow you!'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我实在告诉你们，人为神的国，撇下房屋，或是妻子、弟兄、父母、儿女，
verses.en: Truly I tell you,' Jesus said to them, 'no one who has left home or wife or brothers or sisters or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God

verses.zh: 没有在今世不得百倍，在来世不得永生的。'
verses.en: will fail to receive many times as much in this age, and in the age to come eternal life.'

verses.zh: 耶稣带着十二个门徒，对他们说：'看哪，我们上耶路撒冷去，先知所写的一切事，都要成就在人子身上。
verses.en: Jesus took the Twelve aside and told them, 'We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled.

verses.zh: 他将要被交给外邦人，他们要戏弄他，凌辱他，吐唾沫在他脸上，
verses.en: He will be delivered over to the Gentiles. They will mock him, insult him and spit on him;

verses.zh: 并要鞭打他，杀害他；第三日他要复活。'
verses.en: they will flog him and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.'

verses.zh: 这些事门徒一样也不懂得，意思乃是隐藏的，他们不晓得所说的是什么。
verses.en: The disciples did not understand any of this. Its meaning was hidden from them, and they did not know what he was talking about.

verses.zh: 耶稣将近耶利哥的时候，有一个瞎子坐在路旁讨饭。
verses.en: As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.

verses.zh: 听见许多人经过，就问是什么事。
verses.en: When he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.

verses.zh: 他们告诉他，是拿撒勒人耶稣经过。
verses.en: They told him, 'Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.'

verses.zh: 他就呼叫说：'大卫的子孙耶稣啊，可怜我吧！'
verses.en: He called out, 'Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!'

verses.zh: 在前头走的人，就责备他，不许他作声；他却越发大声呼叫说：'大卫的子孙，可怜我吧！'
verses.en: Those who led the way rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, 'Son of David, have mercy on me!'

verses.zh: 耶稣站住，吩咐把他领过来。既领到跟前，就问他说：
verses.en: Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,

verses.zh: '你要我为你做什么？'他说：'主啊，我要能看见。'
verses.en: 'What do you want me to do for you?' 'Lord, I want to see,' he replied.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你可以看见！你的信救了你了。'
verses.en: Jesus said to him, 'Receive your sight; your faith has healed you.'

verses.zh: 瞎子立刻看见了，就跟随耶稣，一路归荣耀与神。众人看见这事，也赞美神。
verses.en: Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they also praised God.

verses.zh: 耶稣进了耶利哥，正经过的时候，
verses.en: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through.

verses.zh: 有一个人名叫撒该，作税吏长，是个财主。
verses.en: A man was there by the name of Zacchaeus; he was a chief tax collector and was wealthy.

verses.zh: 他要看看耶稣是怎样的人；只因人多，他的身量又矮，所以不得看见，
verses.en: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but because he was short he could not see over the crowd.

verses.zh: 就跑到前头，爬上桑树，要看耶稣，因为耶稣必从那里经过。
verses.en: So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore-fig tree to see him, since Jesus was coming that way.

verses.zh: 耶稣到了那里，抬头一看，对他说：'撒该，快下来！今天我必住在你家里。'
verses.en: When Jesus reached the spot, he looked up and said to him, 'Zacchaeus, come down immediately. I must stay at your house today.'

verses.zh: 他就急忙下来，欢欢喜喜地接待耶稣。
verses.en: So he came down at once and welcomed him gladly.

verses.zh: 众人看见，都私下议论说：'他竟到罪人家里去住宿。'
verses.en: All the people saw this and began to mutter, 'He has gone to be the guest of a sinner.'

verses.zh: 撒该站着，对主说：'主啊，我把所有的一半给穷人；我若讹诈了谁，就还他四倍。'
verses.en: But Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, 'Look, Lord! Here and now I give half of my possessions to the poor, and if I have cheated anybody out of anything, I will pay back four times the amount.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'今天救恩到了这家，因为他也是亚伯拉罕的子孙。
verses.en: Jesus said to him, 'Today salvation has come to this house, because this man, too, is a son of Abraham.

verses.zh: 人子来，为要寻找、拯救失丧的人。'
verses.en: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.'

verses.zh: 众人正在听见这话的时候，耶稣因为将近耶路撒冷，又因他们以为神的国快要显出来，就另设一个比喻，说：
verses.en: While they were listening to this, he went on to tell them a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and the people thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear at once.

verses.zh: '有一个贵胄往远方去，要得国回来。
verses.en: He said: 'A man of noble birth went to a distant country to have himself appointed king and then to return.

verses.zh: 便叫了他的十个仆人来，交给他们十锭银子，说：你们去作生意，直等我回来。
verses.en: So he called ten of his servants and gave them ten minas. 'Put this money to work,' he said, 'until I come back.'

verses.zh: 他本国的人却恨他，打发使者随后去，说：我们不愿意这个人作我们的王。
verses.en: But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him to say, 'We don't want this man to be our king.'

verses.zh: 他既得国回来，就吩咐叫那领银子的仆人来，要知道他们作生意赚了多少。
verses.en: He was made king, however, and returned home. Then he sent for the servants to whom he had given the money, in order to find out what they had gained with it.

verses.zh: 头一个上来，说：主啊，你的一锭银子，已经赚了十锭。
verses.en: The first one came and said, 'Sir, your mina has earned ten more.'

verses.zh: 主人说：好！良善的仆人，你既在最小的事上有忠心，可以有权柄管十座城。
verses.en: 'Well done, my good servant!' his master replied. 'Because you have been trustworthy in a very small matter, take charge of ten cities.'

verses.zh: 第二个来，说：主啊，你的一锭银子，赚了五锭。
verses.en: The second came and said, 'Sir, your mina has earned five more.'

verses.zh: 主人说：你也可以管五座城。
verses.en: His master answered, 'You take charge of five cities.'

verses.zh: 又有一个来说：主啊，看哪，你的一锭银子在这里，我把它包在手巾里存着；
verses.en: Then another servant came and said, 'Sir, here is your mina; I have kept it laid away in a piece of cloth.

verses.zh: 我原是怕你，因为你是严厉的人；没有放下的，还要拿走，没有种下的，还要收割。
verses.en: I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You take out what you did not put in and reap what you did not sow.'

verses.zh: 主人对他说：你这恶仆，我要凭你的口定你的罪。你既知道我是严厉的人，没有放下的，还要拿走，没有种下的，还要收割，
verses.en: His master replied, 'I will judge you by your own words, you wicked servant! You knew, did you, that I am a hard man, taking out what I did not put in, and reaping what I did not sow?

verses.zh: 为什么不把我的银子交给银行，等我来的时候，连本带利都可以要回来呢？
verses.en: Why then didn't you put my money on deposit, so that when I came back, I could have collected it with interest?'

verses.zh: 就对旁边站着的人说：夺过他这一锭来，给那有十锭的。
verses.en: Then he said to those standing by, 'Take his mina away from him and give it to the one who has ten minas.'

verses.zh: 他们说：主啊，他已经有十锭了。
verses.en: 'Sir,' they said, 'he already has ten!'

verses.zh: 主人说：我告诉你们，凡有的，还要加给他；没有的，连他所有的，也要夺过来。
verses.en: 'He replied, 'I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but as for the one who has nothing, even what they have will be taken away.

verses.zh: 至于我那些仇敌，不要我作他们王的，把他们拉来，在我面前杀了吧！'
verses.en: But those enemies of mine who did not want me to be king over them—bring them here and kill them in front of me.''

verses.zh: 耶稣说完了这话，就在前面走，上耶路撒冷去。
verses.en: After Jesus had said this, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 将近伯法其和伯大尼，在一座山名叫橄榄山那里，就打发两个门徒，说：
verses.en: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany at the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples, saying to them,

verses.zh: '你们往对面村子里去，进去的时候，必看见一匹驴驹拴在那里，是从来没有人骑过的，可以解开牵来。
verses.en: 'Go to the village ahead of you, and as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.

verses.zh: 若有人问为什么解它，你们就说：主要用它。'
verses.en: If anyone asks you, 'Why are you untying it?' say, 'The Lord needs it.''

verses.zh: 打发的人去了，所遇见的，正如耶稣所说的。
verses.en: Those who were sent ahead went and found it just as he had told them.

verses.zh: 他们解驴驹的时候，主人问他们说：'解驴驹做什么？'
verses.en: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, 'Why are you untying the colt?'

verses.zh: 他们说：'主要用它。'
verses.en: They replied, 'The Lord needs it.'

verses.zh: 他们牵到耶稣那里，把自己的衣服搭在上面，请耶稣骑上。
verses.en: They brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt and put Jesus on it.

verses.zh: 走的时候，众人把衣服铺在路上。
verses.en: As he went along, people spread their cloaks on the road.

verses.zh: 将近耶路撒冷，正下橄榄山的时候，众门徒因所见过的一切异能，都欢乐起来，大声赞美神，
verses.en: When he came near the place where the road goes down the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began joyfully to praise God in loud voices for all the miracles they had seen:

verses.zh: 说：'奉主名来的王，是应当称颂的！在天上有和平；在至高之处有荣耀！'
verses.en: 'Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!' 'Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!'

verses.zh: 众人中有几个法利赛人对耶稣说：'夫子，责备你的门徒吧！'
verses.en: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Jesus, 'Teacher, rebuke your disciples!'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'我告诉你们，若是他们闭口不说，这些石头必要呼叫起来。'
verses.en: I tell you,' he replied, 'if they keep quiet, the stones will cry out.'

verses.zh: 耶稣快到耶路撒冷，看见城，就为它哀哭，
verses.en: As he approached Jerusalem and saw the city, he wept over it

verses.zh: 说：'巴不得你在这一日知道关系你平安的事；无奈这事现在是隐藏的，叫你的眼看不出来。
verses.en: and said, 'If you, even you, had only known on this day what would bring you peace—but now it is hidden from your eyes.

verses.zh: 因为日子将到，你的仇敌必筑起土垒，周围环绕你，四面困住你，
verses.en: The days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and encircle you and hem you in on every side.

verses.zh: 并要扫灭你和你里头的儿女，连一块石头也不留在石头上，因你不知道眷顾你的时候。'
verses.en: They will dash you to the ground, you and the children within your walls. They will not leave one stone on another, because you did not recognize the time of God's coming to you.'

verses.zh: 耶稣进了殿，赶出里头作买卖的人，
verses.en: When Jesus entered the temple courts, he began to drive out those who were selling.

verses.zh: 对他们说：'经上说：我的殿必作祷告的殿，你们倒使它成为贼窝了。'
verses.en: It is written,' he said to them, ''My house will be a house of prayer'; but you have made it 'a den of robbers.''

verses.zh: 耶稣天天在殿里教训人。祭司长和文士，与百姓的尊长，都想要杀他；
verses.en: Every day he was teaching at the temple. But the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the leaders among the people were trying to kill him.

verses.zh: 但寻不出法子来，因为百姓都侧耳听他。
verses.en: Yet they could not find any way to do it, because all the people hung on his words.

verses.zh: 有一天，耶稣在殿里教训百姓，讲福音的时候，祭司长和文士并长老上前来说：
verses.en: One day as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courts and proclaiming the good news, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, together with the elders, came up to him.

verses.zh: '你告诉我们，你仗着什么权柄作这些事？给你这权柄的是谁呢？'
verses.en: 'Tell us by what authority you are doing these things,' they said. 'Who gave you this authority?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'我也要问你们一句话，你们且告诉我：
verses.en: He replied, 'I will also ask you a question. Tell me:

verses.zh: 约翰的洗礼是从天上来的，是从人间来的呢？'
verses.en: John's baptism—was it from heaven, or of human origin?'

verses.zh: 他们彼此商议说：'我们若说从天上来，他必说：你们为什么不信他呢？
verses.en: They discussed it among themselves and said, 'If we say, 'From heaven,' he will ask, 'Why didn't you believe him?'

verses.zh: 若说从人间来，百姓都要用石头打我们，因为他们信约翰是先知。'
verses.en: But if we say, 'Of human origin,' all the people will stone us, because they are persuaded that John was a prophet.'

verses.zh: 于是回答说：'不知道是从哪里来的。'
verses.en: So they answered, 'We don't know where it was from.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我也不告诉你们，我仗着什么权柄作这些事。'
verses.en: Jesus said, 'Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就对百姓设比喻说：'有人栽了一个葡萄园，租给园户，就往外国去住了许久。
verses.en: He went on to tell the people this parable: 'A man planted a vineyard, rented it to some farmers and went away for a long time.

verses.zh: 到了时候，打发一个仆人到园户那里去，叫他们把园中当纳的果子给他。但园户打了他，叫他空手回去。
verses.en: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants so they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

verses.zh: 又打发一个仆人去，他们也打了他，并且凌辱他，叫他空手回去。
verses.en: He sent another servant, but that one also they beat and treated shamefully and sent away empty-handed.

verses.zh: 又打发第三个去，他们也打伤了他，把他推出去了。
verses.en: He sent still a third, and they wounded him and threw him out.

verses.zh: 园主说：我怎么办呢？我要打发我的爱子去，或者他们尊敬他。
verses.en: Then the owner of the vineyard said, 'What shall I do? I will send my son, whom I love; perhaps they will respect him.'

verses.zh: 不料，园户看见他，就彼此商量说：这是承受产业的，我们杀他吧，使产业归于我们！
verses.en: But when the tenants saw him, they talked the matter over. 'This is the heir,' they said. 'Let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.'

verses.zh: 于是把他推出葡萄园外杀了。这样，葡萄园的主人要怎样处治他们呢？
verses.en: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?

verses.zh: 他要来除灭这些园户，将葡萄园转给别人。'听见的人说：'这是万不可的！'
verses.en: He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.' When the people heard this, they said, 'God forbid!'

verses.zh: 耶稣看着他们说：'经上所记的：匠人所弃的石头，已作了房角的头块石头。这是什么意思呢？
verses.en: Jesus looked directly at them and asked, 'Then what is the meaning of that which is written: ''The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone'?

verses.zh: 凡掉在那石头上的，必要跌碎；那石头掉在谁的身上，谁就要被砸得稀烂。'
verses.en: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces; anyone on whom it falls will be crushed.''

verses.zh: 文士和祭司长看出这比喻是指着他们说的，当时就想要下手拿他，只是惧怕百姓。
verses.en: The teachers of the law and the chief priests looked for a way to arrest him immediately, because they knew he had spoken this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.

verses.zh: 于是窥探耶稣，打发奸细装作好人，要在他的话上得把柄，好将他交在巡抚的政权之下。
verses.en: Keeping a close watch on him, they sent spies, who pretended to be sincere. They hoped to catch Jesus in something he said, so that they might hand him over to the power and authority of the governor.

verses.zh: 奸细就问他说：'夫子，我们晓得你所讲所传都是正直的，也不取人的外貌，乃是诚诚实实传神的道。
verses.en: So the spies questioned him: 'Teacher, we know that you speak and teach what is right, and that you do not show partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.

verses.zh: 纳税给凯撒可以不可以？'
verses.en: Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?'

verses.zh: 耶稣看出他们的诡诈，就对他们说：
verses.en: He saw through their duplicity and said to them,

verses.zh: '拿一个银钱来给我看。这像和这号是谁的？'他们说：'是凯撒的。'
verses.en: 'Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?' 'Caesar's,' they replied.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'这样，凯撒的物当归给凯撒，神的物当归给神。'
verses.en: He said to them, 'Then give back to Caesar what is Caesar's and to God what is God's.'

verses.zh: 他们当着百姓，在这话上得不着把柄，又希奇他的应对，就闭口无言了。
verses.en: They were unable to trap him in what he had said there in public. And astonished by his answer, they became silent.

verses.zh: 撒都该人常说没有复活的事。有几个来问耶稣说：
verses.en: Some of the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Jesus with a question.

verses.zh: '夫子，摩西为我们写着说：人若有妻无子就死了，他兄弟当娶他的妻，为哥哥生子立后。
verses.en: 'Teacher,' they said, 'Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.

verses.zh: 有弟兄七人，第一个娶了妻，没有孩子死了；
verses.en: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married a woman and died childless.

verses.zh: 第二个、第三个也都娶过她；
verses.en: The second

verses.zh: 那七个人都娶过她，没有留下孩子就死了。
verses.en: and the third married her, and in the same way the seven died, leaving no children.

verses.zh: 末后，妇人也死了。
verses.en: Finally, the woman died too.

verses.zh: 这样，当复活的时候，她是哪一个的妻子呢？因为他们七个人都娶过她。'
verses.en: Now then, at the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'这世界的人有娶有嫁；
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.

verses.zh: 惟有算为配得那世界，与从死里复活的人，也不娶也不嫁；
verses.en: But those who are considered worthy of taking part in the age to come and in the resurrection from the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage,

verses.zh: 因为他们不能再死，和天使一样；既是复活的人，就为神的儿子。
verses.en: and they can no longer die; for they are like the angels. They are God's children, since they are children of the resurrection.

verses.zh: 至于死人复活，摩西在荆棘篇上，称主是亚伯拉罕的神，以撒的神，雅各的神，就指示明白了。
verses.en: But in the account of the burning bush, even Moses showed that the dead rise, for he calls the Lord 'the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.'

verses.zh: 神不是死人的神，乃是活人的神；因为在他那里，人都是活的。'
verses.en: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for to him all are alive.'

verses.zh: 有几个文士说：'夫子，你说得好。'
verses.en: Some of the teachers of the law responded, 'Well said, teacher!'

verses.zh: 以后他们不敢再问他什么。
verses.en: And no one dared to ask him any more questions.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'人怎么说基督是大卫的子孙呢？
verses.en: Then Jesus said to them, 'Why is it said that the Messiah is the son of David?

verses.zh: 诗篇上大卫自己说：主对我主说：你坐在我的右边，
verses.en: David himself declares in the Book of Psalms: ''The Lord said to my Lord: 'Sit at my right hand

verses.zh: 等我使你仇敌作你的脚凳。
verses.en: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.''

verses.zh: 大卫既称他为主，他怎么又是大卫的子孙呢？'
verses.en: David calls him 'Lord.' How then can he be his son?'

verses.zh: 众百姓听的时候，耶稣对门徒说：
verses.en: While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,

verses.zh: '你们要防备文士。他们好穿长衣游行，喜爱人在街市上问他们安，又喜爱会堂里的高位，筵席上的首座；
verses.en: 'Beware of the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.

verses.zh: 他们侵吞寡妇的家产，假意作很长的祷告。这些人要受更重的刑罚。'
verses.en: They devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These men will be punished most severely.''

verses.zh: 耶稣抬头观看，见财主把捐项投在库里；
verses.en: As Jesus looked up, he saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.

verses.zh: 又见一个穷寡妇，投了两个小钱，
verses.en: He also saw a poor widow put in two very small copper coins.

verses.zh: 就说：'我实在告诉你们，这穷寡妇所投的，比众人还多；
verses.en: 'Truly I tell you,' he said, 'this poor widow has put in more than all the others.

verses.zh: 因为众人都是自己有余，拿出来投在捐项里；但这寡妇是自己不足，把她一切养生的都投上了。'
verses.en: All these people gave their gifts out of their wealth; but she out of her poverty put in all she had to live on.'

verses.zh: 有人谈论圣殿是用美石和供物妆饰的，
verses.en: Some of his disciples were remarking about how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and with gifts dedicated to God. But Jesus said,

verses.zh: 耶稣就说：'论到你们所看见的这一切，将来日子到了，没有一块石头留在石头上，不被拆毁了。'
verses.en: 'As for what you see here, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another; every one of them will be thrown down.'

verses.zh: 他们问他说：'夫子，什么时候有这事呢？这事将到的时候，有什么预兆呢？'
verses.en: 'Teacher,' they asked, 'when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are about to take place?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们要谨慎，不要受迷惑；因为将来有好些人冒我的名来，说：我是基督，又说：时候近了。你们不要跟从他们！
verses.en: He replied: 'Watch out that you are not deceived. For many will come in my name, claiming, 'I am he,' and, 'The time is near.' Do not follow them.

verses.zh: 你们听见打仗和扰乱的事，不要惊惶；因为这些事必须先有，只是末期不能立时就到。'
verses.en: When you hear of wars and uprisings, do not be frightened. These things must happen first, but the end will not come right away.'

verses.zh: 当时他对他们说：'民要攻打民，国要攻打国；
verses.en: Then he said to them: 'Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

verses.zh: 地要大大震动，多处必有饥荒、瘟疫，又有可怕的异象和大神迹从天上显现。
verses.en: There will be great earthquakes, famines and pestilences in various places, and fearful events and great signs from heaven.

verses.zh: 但这一切的事以先，人要下手拿住你们，逼迫你们，把你们交给会堂，并且收在监里，又为我的名拉你们到君王诸侯面前。
verses.en: 'But before all this, they will seize you and persecute you. They will hand you over to synagogues and put you in prison, and you will be brought before kings and governors, and all on account of my name.

verses.zh: 但这些事终必为你们的见证。
verses.en: And so you will bear testimony to me.

verses.zh: 所以，你们当立定心意，不要预先思想怎样分诉；
verses.en: But make up your mind not to worry beforehand how you will defend yourselves.

verses.zh: 因为我必赐给你们口才、智慧，是你们一切敌人所敌不住、驳不倒的。
verses.en: For I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.

verses.zh: 连你们的父母、弟兄、亲族、朋友也要把你们交官；你们也有被他们害死的。
verses.en: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers and sisters, relatives and friends, and they will put some of you to death.

verses.zh: 你们要为我的名，被众人恨恶。
verses.en: Everyone will hate you because of me.

verses.zh: 然而，你们连一根头发也必不损坏。
verses.en: But not a hair of your head will perish.

verses.zh: 你们常存忍耐，就必保全灵魂（或作：必得生命）。'
verses.en: Stand firm, and you will win life.

verses.zh: 你们看见耶路撒冷被兵围困，就可知道它荒凉的日子近了。
verses.en: 'When you see Jerusalem being surrounded by armies, you will know that its desolation is near.

verses.zh: 那时，在犹太的应当逃到山上；在城里的应当出来；在乡下的不要进城。
verses.en: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those in the city get out, and let those in the country not enter the city.

verses.zh: 因为这是报应的日子，使经上所写的都得应验。
verses.en: For this is the time of punishment in fulfillment of all that has been written.

verses.zh: 当那些日子，怀孕的和奶孩子的有祸了！因为将有大灾难降在这地方，也有震怒临到这百姓。
