verses.en: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers! There will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.

verses.zh: 他们要倒在刀下，又被掳到各国去。耶路撒冷要被外邦人践踏，直到外邦人的日期满了。'
verses.en: They will fall by the sword and will be taken as prisoners to all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

verses.zh: 日头要变黑，月亮要变血，星辰要坠落，天势要震动。
verses.en: 'There will be signs in the sun, moon and stars. On the earth, nations will be in anguish and perplexity at the roaring and tossing of the sea.

verses.zh: 人们昏迷不醒，心因思念和惧怕将要来的事而消溶。
verses.en: People will faint from terror, apprehensive of what is coming on the world, for the heavenly bodies will be shaken.

verses.zh: 那时，他们要看见人子有能力，有大荣耀，驾云降临。
verses.en: At that time they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

verses.zh: 一有这些事，你们就当挺身昂首，因为你们得赎的日子近了。'
verses.en: When these things begin to take place, stand up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又设比喻对他们说：'你们看无花果树和各样的树；
verses.en: He told them this parable: 'Look at the fig tree and all the trees.

verses.zh: 它发芽的时候，你们一看见，自然晓得夏天近了。
verses.en: When they sprout leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is near.

verses.zh: 这样，你们看见这些事渐渐地成就，也该晓得神的国近了。
verses.en: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，这世代还没有过去，这些事都要成就。
verses.en: 'Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

verses.zh: 天地要废去，我的话却不能废去。'
verses.en: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.zh: '你们要谨慎，恐怕因贪食、醉酒，并今生的思虑累住你们的心，那日子就如同网罗忽然临到你们；
verses.en: 'Be careful, or your hearts will be weighed down with carousing, drunkenness and the anxieties of life, and that day will close on you suddenly like a trap.

verses.zh: 因为那日子要这样临到全地上一切居住的人。
verses.en: For it will come on all those who live on the face of the whole earth.

verses.zh: 你们要时时儆醒，常常祈求，使你们能逃避这一切要来的事，得以站立在人子面前。'
verses.en: Be always on the watch, and pray that you may be able to escape all that is about to happen, and that you may be able to stand before the Son of Man.'

verses.zh: 耶稣每日在殿里教训人，每夜出城在一座山名叫橄榄山住宿。
verses.en: Each day Jesus was teaching at the temple, and each evening he went out to spend the night on the hill called the Mount of Olives,

verses.zh: 众百姓清早上圣殿，到他那里，要听他讲道。
verses.en: and all the people came early in the morning to hear him at the temple.

verses.zh: 除酵节，又名逾越节，近了。
verses.en: Now the Festival of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was approaching,

verses.zh: 祭司长和文士想法子怎么才能杀害耶稣，是因他们惧怕百姓。
verses.en: and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were looking for some way to get rid of Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.

verses.zh: 这时，撒但入了那称为加略人犹大的心，他本是十二门徒里的一个。
verses.en: Then Satan entered Judas, called Iscariot, one of the Twelve.

verses.zh: 他去和祭司长并守殿官商量，怎么可以把耶稣交给他们。
verses.en: And Judas went to the chief priests and the officers of the temple guard and discussed with them how he might betray Jesus.

verses.zh: 他们欢喜，就约定给他银子。
verses.en: They were delighted and agreed to give him money.

verses.zh: 他应允了，就找机会，要趁众人不在跟前的时候，把耶稣交给他们。
verses.en: He consented, and watched for an opportunity to hand Jesus over to them when no crowd was present.

verses.zh: 除酵节，须宰逾越羊羔的那一天到了。
verses.en: Then came the day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.

verses.zh: 耶稣打发彼得、约翰，说：'你们去为我们预备逾越节的筵席，好叫我们吃。'
verses.en: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, 'Go and make preparations for us to eat the Passover.'

verses.zh: 他们问他说：'要我们在哪里预备？'
verses.en: 'Where do you want us to prepare for it?' they asked.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们进了城，必有人拿着一瓶水迎面而来，你们就跟着他，到他所进的房子里去，
verses.en: He replied, 'As you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him to the house that he enters,

verses.zh: 对那家的主人说：夫子说：客房在哪里？我与门徒好在那里吃逾越节的筵席。
verses.en: and say to the owner of the house, 'The Teacher asks: Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?'

verses.zh: 他必指给你们摆设整齐的一间大楼，你们就在那里预备。'
verses.en: He will show you a large room upstairs, all furnished. Make preparations there.'

verses.zh: 他们去了，所遇见的正如耶稣所说的。他们就预备了逾越节的筵席。
verses.en: They left and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.

verses.zh: 时候到了，耶稣坐席，使徒也和他同坐。
verses.en: When the hour came, Jesus and his apostles reclined at the table.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'我很愿意在受害以先，和你们吃这逾越节的筵席。
verses.en: And he said to them, 'I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，我不再吃这筵席，直到成就在神的国里。'
verses.en: For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it finds fulfillment in the kingdom of God.'

verses.zh: 耶稣接过杯来，祝谢了，说：'你们拿这个，大家分着喝。
verses.en: After taking the cup, he gave thanks and said, 'Take this and divide it among you.

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，从今以后，我不再喝这葡萄汁，直等神的国来到。'
verses.en: For I tell you I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.'

verses.zh: 又拿起饼来，祝谢了，就擘开，递给他们，说：'这是我的身体，为你们舍的，你们也应当如此行，为的是记念我。'
verses.en: And he took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, 'This is my body given for you; do this in remembrance of me.'

verses.zh: 饭后也照样拿起杯来，说：'这杯是用我血所立的新约，是为你们流出来的。
verses.en: In the same way, after the supper he took the cup, saying, 'This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

verses.zh: 看哪，那卖我之人的手，与我一同在桌子上。
verses.en: But the hand of him who is going to betray me is with mine on the table.

verses.zh: 人子固然要照所预定的去世，但卖人子的人有祸了！'
verses.en: The Son of Man will go as it has been decreed. But woe to that man who betrays him!'

verses.zh: 他们就彼此对问，是哪一个要作这事。
verses.en: They began to question among themselves which of them it might be who would do this.

verses.zh: 门徒起了争论，他们中间哪一个可算为大。
verses.en: A dispute also arose among them as to which of them was considered to be the greatest.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'外邦人有君王为主治理他们，那掌权管他们的称为恩主。
verses.en: Jesus said to them, 'The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and those who exercise authority over them call themselves Benefactors.

verses.zh: 但你们不可这样；你们里头为大的，倒要像年幼的；为首领的，倒要像服事人的。
verses.en: But you are not to be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the one who rules like the one who serves.

verses.zh: 是谁为大？是坐席的呢？是服事人的呢？不是坐席的为大吗？然而，我在你们中间如同服事人的。
verses.en: For who is greater, the one who is at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.

verses.zh: 我在磨炼之中，常和我同在的就是你们。
verses.en: You are those who have stood by me in my trials.

verses.zh: 我将国赐给你们，正如我父赐给我一样，
verses.en: And I confer on you a kingdom, just as my Father conferred one on me,

verses.zh: 叫你们在我国里，坐在我的席上吃喝，并且坐在宝座上，审判以色列十二个支派。'
verses.en: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.zh: 主又说：'西门！西门！撒但想要得着你们，好筛你们像筛麦子一样；
verses.en: 'Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to sift all of you as wheat.

verses.zh: 但我已经为你祈求，叫你不至于失了信心。你回头以后，要坚固你的弟兄。'
verses.en: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'主啊，我就是同你下监，同你受死，也是甘心！'
verses.en: But he replied, 'Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'彼得，我告诉你，今日鸡还没有叫，你要三次说不认得我。'
verses.en: Jesus answered, 'I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know me.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又对他们说：'我差你们出去的时候，没有钱囊，没有口袋，没有鞋，你们缺少什么没有？'他们说：'没有。'
verses.en: Then Jesus asked them, 'When I sent you without purse, bag or sandals, did you lack anything?' 'Nothing,' they answered.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'但如今有钱囊的可以带着，有口袋的也可以带着，没有刀的要卖衣服买刀。
verses.en: He said to them, 'But now if you have a purse, take it, and also a bag; and if you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，经上写着说：他被列在罪犯之中。这话必应验在我身上，因为那关系我的事，必然成就。'
verses.en: It is written: 'And he was numbered with the transgressors'; and I tell you that this must be fulfilled in me. Yes, what is written about me is reaching its fulfillment.'

verses.zh: 他们说：'主啊，请看，这里有两把刀。'耶稣说：'够了。'
verses.en: The disciples said, 'See, Lord, here are two swords.' 'That's enough!' he replied.

verses.zh: 耶稣出来，照常往橄榄山去，门徒也跟随他。
verses.en: Jesus went out as usual to the Mount of Olives, and his disciples followed him.

verses.zh: 到了那地方，就对他们说：'你们要祷告，免得入了迷惑。'
verses.en: On reaching the place, he said to them, 'Pray that you will not fall into temptation.'

verses.zh: 他自己离开他们约有扔一块石头那么远，跪下祷告，
verses.en: He withdrew about a stone's throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed,

verses.zh: 说：'父啊，你若愿意，就把这杯撤去；然而，不要成就我的意思，只要成就你的意思。'
verses.en: 'Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.'

verses.zh: 有一位天使从天上显现，加添他的力量。
verses.en: An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.

verses.zh: 耶稣极其伤痛，祷告更加恳切，汗珠如大血点，滴在地上。
verses.en: And being in anguish, he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.

verses.zh: 祷告完了，就起来，到门徒那里，见他们因为忧愁都睡着了，
verses.en: When he rose from prayer and went back to the disciples, he found them asleep, exhausted from sorrow.

verses.zh: 就对他们说：'你们为什么睡觉呢？起来祷告，免得入了迷惑。'
verses.en: 'Why are you sleeping?' he asked them. 'Get up and pray so that you will not fall into temptation.'

verses.zh: 说话之间，来了许多人，那十二个门徒里名叫犹大的，走在前头，就近耶稣，要与他亲嘴。
verses.en: While he was still speaking a crowd came up, and the man who was called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He approached Jesus to kiss him,

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'犹大，你用亲嘴的暗号卖人子吗？'
verses.en: but Jesus asked him, 'Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?'

verses.zh: 左右的人见光景不好，就说：'主啊，我们拿刀砍可以不可以？'
verses.en: When Jesus' followers saw what was going to happen, they said, 'Lord, should we strike with our swords?'

verses.zh: 内中有一个砍了大祭司的仆人一刀，削掉了他的右耳。
verses.en: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'到了这个地步，由他们吧！'就摸那人的耳朵，把他治好了。
verses.en: But Jesus answered, 'No more of this!' And he touched the man's ear and healed him.

verses.zh: 耶稣对那些来拿他的祭司长和守殿官并长老说：'你们带着刀棒出来拿我，如同拿强盗吗？
verses.en: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders, who had come for him, 'Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come with swords and clubs?

verses.zh: 我天天同你们在殿里，你们不下手拿我。现在却是你们的时候，黑暗掌权了。'
verses.en: Every day I was with you in the temple courts, and you did not lay a hand on me. But this is your hour—when darkness reigns.'

verses.zh: 他们拿住耶稣，把他带到大祭司的宅里。彼得远远地跟着。
verses.en: Then seizing him, they led him away and took him into the house of the high priest. Peter followed at a distance.

verses.zh: 他们在院子里生了火，一同坐着，彼得也坐在他们中间。
verses.en: And when some there had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter sat down with them.

verses.zh: 有一个使女看见彼得坐在火光里，就定睛看他，说：'这个人素来也是同那人一伙的。'
verses.en: A servant girl saw him seated there in the firelight. She also had seen him before, and she said to the others, 'This man was with him.'

verses.zh: 彼得却不承认，说：'女子，我不认得他。'
verses.en: But he denied it. 'Woman, I don't know him,' he said.

verses.zh: 过了不多的时候，又有一个人看见他，说：'你也是他们一党的。'彼得说：'你这个人，我不是！'
verses.en: A little later someone else saw him and said, 'You also are one of them.' 'Man, I am not!' Peter replied.

verses.zh: 约过了一小时，又有一个人极力地说：'他真是同那人一伙的，因为他也是加利利人。'
verses.en: About an hour later another asserted, 'Certainly this fellow was with him, for he is a Galilean.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'你这个人，我不知道你说的是什么！'刚说这话，鸡就叫了。
verses.en: Peter replied, 'Man, I don't know what you're talking about!' Just as he was speaking, the rooster crowed.

verses.zh: 主转过身来，看彼得。彼得便想起主对他所说的话：今日鸡叫以先，你要三次不认我。
verses.en: The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word the Lord had spoken to him: 'Before the rooster crows today, you will disown me three times.'

verses.zh: 他就出去痛哭。
verses.en: And he went outside and wept bitterly.

verses.zh: 看守耶稣的人戏弄他，打他，
verses.en: The men who were guarding Jesus began mocking and beating him.

verses.zh: 又蒙着他的眼，问他说：'你是先知，告诉我们，打你的是谁？'
verses.en: They blindfolded him and demanded, 'Prophesy! Who hit you?'

verses.zh: 他们还用许多别的话辱骂他。
verses.en: And they said many other insulting things to him.

verses.zh: 天一亮，民间的长老连祭司长带文士都聚会，把耶稣带到他们的公会里，
verses.en: At daybreak the council of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and the teachers of the law, met together, and Jesus was led before them.

verses.zh: 说：'你若是基督，就告诉我们。'耶稣说：'我若告诉你们，你们也不信；
verses.en: 'If you are the Messiah,' they said, 'tell us.' Jesus answered, 'If I tell you, you will not believe me,

verses.zh: 我若问你们，你们也不回答。
verses.en: and if I asked you, you would not answer.

verses.zh: 从今以后，人子要坐在神权能的右边。'
verses.en: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the mighty God.'

verses.zh: 他们都说：'这样，你是神的儿子吗？'耶稣说：'你们所说的是。'
verses.en: They all asked, 'Are you then the Son of God?' He replied, 'You say that I am.'

verses.zh: 他们说：'何必再用见证呢？他亲口所说的，我们都亲自听见了。'
verses.en: Then they said, 'Why do we need any more testimony? We have heard it from his own lips.'

verses.zh: 众人起来，把耶稣解到彼拉多面前，
verses.en: Then the whole assembly rose and led him off to Pilate.

verses.zh: 就告他说：'我们见这人诱惑国民，禁止纳税给凯撒，并说自己是基督，是王。'
verses.en: And they began to accuse him, saying, 'We have found this man subverting our nation. He opposes payment of taxes to Caesar and claims to be Messiah, a king.'

verses.zh: 彼拉多问耶稣说：'你是犹太人的王吗？'耶稣回答说：'你说的是。'
verses.en: So Pilate asked Jesus, 'Are you the king of the Jews?' 'You have said so,' Jesus replied.

verses.zh: 彼拉多对祭司长和众人说：'我查不出这人有甚么罪来。'
verses.en: Then Pilate announced to the chief priests and the crowd, 'I find no basis for a charge against this man.'

verses.zh: 但他们越发极力地说：'他煽惑百姓，在犹太遍地传道，从加利利起，直到这里了。'
verses.en: But they insisted, 'He stirs up the people all over Judea by his teaching. He started in Galilee and has come all the way here.'

verses.zh: 彼拉多一听见，就问：'这人是加利利人吗？'
verses.en: On hearing this, Pilate asked if the man was a Galilean.

verses.zh: 既晓得耶稣属希律所管，就把他送到希律那里去。那时希律正在耶路撒冷。
verses.en: When he learned that Jesus was under Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.

verses.zh: 希律看见耶稣，就很欢喜，因为听见过他的事，久已想要见他，并且指望看他行一件神迹。
verses.en: When Herod saw Jesus, he was greatly pleased, because for a long time he had been wanting to see him. From what he had heard about him, he hoped to see him perform a sign of some sort.

verses.zh: 于是问他许多的话，耶稣却一言不答。
verses.en: He plied him with many questions, but Jesus gave him no answer.

verses.zh: 祭司长和文士都站着，极力地告他。
verses.en: The chief priests and the teachers of the law were standing there, vehemently accusing him.

verses.zh: 希律和他的兵丁就藐视耶稣，戏弄他，给他穿上华丽衣服，把他送回彼拉多那里去。
verses.en: Then Herod and his soldiers ridiculed and mocked him. Dressing him in an elegant robe, they sent him back to Pilate.

verses.zh: 从前希律和彼拉多彼此有仇，在那一天就成了朋友。
verses.en: That day Herod and Pilate became friends—before this they had been enemies.

verses.zh: 彼拉多传齐了祭司长和官府并百姓，
verses.en: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers and the people,

verses.zh: 就对他们说：'你们解这人到我这里，说他是诱惑百姓的。看哪，我也曾在你们面前审问他，并没有查出他所告的一切事；
verses.en: and said to them, 'You brought me this man as one who was inciting the people to rebellion. I have examined him in your presence and have found no basis for your charges against him.

verses.zh: 连希律也是如此，所以把他送回来。可见他没有做过一点该死的事。
verses.en: Neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us; as you can see, he has done nothing to deserve death.

verses.zh: 故此，我要责打他，把他释放了。'
verses.en: Therefore, I will punish him and then release him.''

verses.zh: （每逢这节期，巡抚必须释放一个囚犯给他们。）
verses.en: [There was a note in a festival for him to release a prisoner to the people, whoever they requested.]

verses.zh: 众人却一齐喊着说：'除掉这个人！释放巴拉巴给我们！'
verses.en: But the whole crowd shouted, 'Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!'

verses.zh: 这巴拉巴是因在城里作乱杀人下在监里的。
verses.en: (Barabbas had been thrown into prison for an insurrection in the city, and for murder.)

verses.zh: 彼拉多愿意释放耶稣，就又劝解他们。
verses.en: Wanting to release Jesus, Pilate appealed to them again.

verses.zh: 无奈他们喊着说：'钉他十字架！钉他十字架！'
verses.en: But they kept shouting, 'Crucify him! Crucify him!'

verses.zh: 彼拉多第三次对他们说：'为什么呢？这人做了什么恶事呢？我并没有查出他一点该死的罪来。所以，我要责打他，把他释放了。'
verses.en: For the third time he spoke to them: 'Why? What crime has this man committed? I have found in him no grounds for the death penalty. Therefore I will have him punished and then release him.'

verses.zh: 他们大声催逼彼拉多，求他把耶稣钉在十字架上。他们的声音就得了胜。
verses.en: But with loud shouts they insistently demanded that he be crucified, and their shouts prevailed.

verses.zh: 彼拉多这才照他们所求的定案，
verses.en: So Pilate decided to grant their demand.

verses.zh: 把他们所求的那作乱杀人下在监里的释放了，把耶稣交给他们，任凭他们的意思行。
verses.en: He released the man who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, the one they asked for, and surrendered Jesus to their will.

verses.zh: 带耶稣去的时候，有一个古利奈人西门，从乡下来，他们就抓住他，把十字架搁在他身上，叫他背着跟随耶稣。
verses.en: As the soldiers led him away, they seized Simon from Cyrene, who was on his way in from the country, and put the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.

verses.zh: 有许多百姓跟随耶稣，内中有好些妇女，妇女们为他号咷痛哭。
verses.en: A large number of people followed him, including women who mourned and wailed for him.

verses.zh: 耶稣转身对她们说：'耶路撒冷的女子，不要为我哭，当为自己和自己的儿女哭。
verses.en: Jesus turned and said to them, 'Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me; weep for yourselves and for your children.

verses.zh: 因为日子要到，人必说：不生育的和未曾怀胎的，未曾乳养婴孩的，有福了！
verses.en: For the time will come when you will say, 'Blessed are the childless women, the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!'

verses.zh: 那时，人要向大山说：倒在我们身上！向小山说：遮盖我们！
verses.en: Then ''they will say to the mountains, 'Fall on us!' and to the hills, 'Cover us!'''

verses.zh: 这些事既行在有汁水的树上，那枯干的树将来怎么样呢？'
verses.en: For if people do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?'

verses.zh: 又有两个犯人，和耶稣一同带来处死。
verses.en: Two other men, both criminals, were also led out with him to be executed.

verses.zh: 到了一个地方名叫髑髅地，就在那里把耶稣钉在十字架上，又钉了两个犯人，一个在左边，一个在右边。
verses.en: When they came to the place called the Skull, they crucified him there, along with the criminals—one on his right, the other on his left.

verses.zh: 当下耶稣说：'父啊，赦免他们，因为他们所作的，他们不晓得。'兵丁就拈阄分他的衣服。
verses.en: Jesus said, 'Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.' And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

verses.zh: 百姓站着观看。官府也嗤笑他说：'他救了别人，他若是基督，神所拣选的，可以救自己吧！'
verses.en: The people stood watching, and the rulers even sneered at him. They said, 'He saved others; let him save himself if he is God's Messiah, the Chosen One.'

verses.zh: 兵丁也戏弄他，上前拿醋送给他喝，
verses.en: The soldiers also came up and mocked him. They offered him wine vinegar

verses.zh: 说：'你若是犹太人的王，可以救自己吧！'
verses.en: and said, 'If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself.'

verses.zh: 在耶稣以上有一个牌子（有古卷在此有）写着：'这是犹太人的王。'
verses.en: There was a written notice above him, which read: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.zh: 那同钉的两个犯人，有一个讥诮他说：'你不是基督吗？可以救自己和我们吧！'
verses.en: One of the criminals who hung there hurled insults at him: 'Aren't you the Messiah? Save yourself and us!'

verses.zh: 那一个就应声责备他说：'你既是一样受刑的，还不怕神吗？
verses.en: But the other criminal rebuked him. 'Don't you fear God,' he said, 'since you are under the same sentence?

verses.zh: 我们是应该的，因我们所受的与我们所作的相称，但这个人没有做过一件不好的事。'
verses.en: We are punished justly, for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong.'

verses.zh: 就说：'耶稣啊，你得国降临的时候，求你记念我！'
verses.en: Then he said, 'Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'我实在告诉你，今日你要同我在乐园里了。'
verses.en: Jesus answered him, 'Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in paradise.'

verses.zh: 那时约有午正，遍地都黑暗了，直到申初，
verses.en: It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,

verses.zh: 日头变黑了。殿里的幔子从当中裂为两半。
verses.en: for the sun stopped shining. And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.

verses.zh: 耶稣大声喊着说：'父啊，我将我的灵魂交在你手里！'说了这话，气就断了。
verses.en: Jesus called out with a loud voice, 'Father, into your hands I commit my spirit.' When he had said this, he breathed his last.

verses.zh: 百夫长看见所成的事，就归荣耀与神，说：'这真是个义人！'
verses.en: The centurion, seeing what had happened, praised God and said, 'Surely this was a righteous man.'

verses.zh: 聚集观看的众人，见了这所成的事，都捶着胸回去了。
verses.en: When all the people who had gathered to witness this sight saw what took place, they beat their breasts and went away.

verses.zh: 还有一切与耶稣熟识的人，和从加利利跟着他来的妇女们，都远远地站着，看这些事。
verses.en: But all those who knew him, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.

verses.zh: 有一个人名叫约瑟，是个议士，为人善良公义，
verses.en: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, a good and upright man,

verses.zh: 众人所谋所为，他并没有附从。他本是犹太亚利马太城里，等候神国的。
verses.en: who had not consented to their decision and action. He came from the Judean town of Arimathea, and he himself was waiting for the kingdom of God.

verses.zh: 这人去见彼拉多，求耶稣的身体，
verses.en: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus' body.

verses.zh: 就取下来，用细麻布裹好，安放在磐石中凿出来的坟墓里，那里头从来没有葬过人。
verses.en: Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen cloth and placed it in a tomb cut in the rock, one in which no one had yet been laid.

verses.zh: 那日是预备日，安息日也快到了。
verses.en: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.

verses.zh: 那些从加利利和耶稣同来的妇女，跟在后面，看见了坟墓和他的身体怎样安放。
verses.en: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.

verses.zh: 她们就回去，预备了香料香膏。她们在安息日，便遵着诫命安息了。
verses.en: Then they went home and prepared spices and perfumes. But they rested on the Sabbath in obedience to the commandment.

verses.zh: 七日的头一日，黎明的时候，那些妇女带着所预备的香料来到坟墓前，
verses.en: On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, the women took the spices they had prepared and went to the tomb.

verses.zh: 看见石头已经从坟墓滚开了，
verses.en: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,

verses.zh: 她们就进去，只是不见主耶稣的身体。
verses.en: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 正在猜疑之间，忽然有两个人站在旁边，衣服放光。
verses.en: While they were wondering about this, suddenly two men in clothes that gleamed like lightning stood beside them.

verses.zh: 妇女们惊怕，将脸伏地。那两个人就对她们说：'为什么在死人中找活人呢？
verses.en: In their fright the women bowed down with their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, 'Why do you look for the living among the dead?

verses.zh: 他不在这里，已经复活了。当记念他还在加利利的时候怎样告诉你们，
verses.en: He is not here; he has risen! Remember how he told you, while he was still with you in Galilee:

verses.zh: 说，人子必须被交在罪人手里，钉在十字架上，第三日复活。'
verses.en: 'The Son of Man must be delivered over to the hands of sinners, be crucified and on the third day be raised again.''

verses.zh: 她们就想起耶稣的话来，
verses.en: Then they remembered his words.

verses.zh: 便从坟墓那里回去，把这一切事告诉十一个使徒和其余的人。
verses.en: When they came back from the tomb, they told all these things to the Eleven and to all the others.

verses.zh: 那告诉使徒的，就是抹大拉的马利亚，和约亚拿，并雅各的母亲马利亚，还有与她们在一处的妇女们。
verses.en: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the others with them who told this to the apostles.

verses.zh: 她们这些话，使徒以为是胡言，就不相信。
verses.en: But they did not believe the women, because their words seemed to them like nonsense.

verses.zh: 彼得却起来，跑到坟墓前，低头往里看，见细麻布独在一处，就回去了，心里希奇所成的事。
verses.en: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he went away, wondering to himself what had happened.

verses.zh: 正当那日，门徒中有两个人往一个村子去，这村子名叫以马忤斯，离耶路撒冷约有二十五里。
verses.en: Now that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 他们彼此谈论所遇见的这一切事。
verses.en: They were talking with each other about everything that had happened.

verses.zh: 正谈论相问的时候，耶稣亲自就近他们，和他们同行；
verses.en: As they talked and discussed these things with each other, Jesus himself came up and walked along with them;

verses.zh: 只是他们的眼睛迷糊了，不认识他。
verses.en: but they were kept from recognizing him.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'你们走路彼此谈论的是什么事呢？'他们就站住，脸上带着愁容。
verses.en: He asked them, 'What are you discussing together as you walk along?' They stood still, their faces downcast.

verses.zh: 二人中有一个名叫革流巴的回答说：'你在耶路撒冷作客，还不知道这几天在那里所出的事吗？'
verses.en: One of them, named Cleopas, asked him, 'Are you the only one living in Jerusalem who doesn't know the things that have happened there in these days?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'什么事呢？'他们说：'就是拿撒勒人耶稣的事。他是个先知，在神和众百姓面前，说话行事都有大能。
verses.en: 'What things?' he asked. 'About Jesus of Nazareth,' they replied. 'He was a prophet, powerful in word and deed before God and all the people.

verses.zh: 祭司长和我们的官府，竟把他解去定了死罪，钉在十字架上。
verses.en: The chief priests and our rulers handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him;

verses.zh: 我们素来所盼望要赎以色列民的就是他。不但如此，而且这事成就，现在已经三天了。
verses.en: but we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. And what is more, it is the third day since all this took place.

verses.zh: 再者，我们中间有几个妇女使我们惊奇，她们清早到了坟墓那里，
verses.en: In addition, some of our women amazed us. They went to the tomb early this morning

verses.zh: 不见他的身体，就回来告诉我们，说看见了天使显现，说他活了。
verses.en: but didn't find his body. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.

verses.zh: 又有我们的几个人往坟墓那里去，所遇见的，正如妇女们所说的，只是没有看见他。'
verses.en: Then some of our companions went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see Jesus.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'无知的人哪，先知所说的一切话，你们的心信得太迟钝了。
verses.en: He said to them, 'How foolish you are, and how slow to believe all that the prophets have spoken!

verses.zh: 基督这样受害，又进入他的荣耀，岂不是应当的吗？'
verses.en: Did not the Messiah have to suffer these things and then enter his glory?'

verses.zh: 于是从摩西和众先知起，凡经上所指着自己的话，都给他们讲解明白了。
verses.en: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he explained to them what was said in all the Scriptures concerning himself.

verses.zh: 将近他们所去的村子，耶稣好像还要往前行，
verses.en: As they approached the village to which they were going, Jesus continued on as if he were going farther.

verses.zh: 他们却强留他说：'时候晚了，日头已经平西了，请你同我们住下吧！'耶稣就进去，要同他们住下。
verses.en: But they urged him strongly, 'Stay with us, for it is nearly evening; the day is almost over.' So he went in to stay with them.

verses.zh: 到了坐席的时候，耶稣拿起饼来，祝谢了，擘开，递给他们。
verses.en: When he was at the table with them, he took bread, gave thanks, broke it and began to give it to them.

verses.zh: 他们的眼睛明亮了，这才认出他来。忽然耶稣不见了。
verses.en: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he disappeared from their sight.

verses.zh: 他们彼此说：'在路上，他和我们说话，给我们讲解圣经的时候，我们的心岂不是火热的吗？'
verses.en: They asked each other, 'Were not our hearts burning within us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?'

verses.zh: 他们就立刻起身，回耶路撒冷去，正遇见十一个使徒和他们的同人聚集在一处，
verses.en: They got up and returned at once to Jerusalem. There they found the Eleven and those with them, assembled together

verses.zh: 说：'主果然复活了，已经现给西门看了。'
verses.en: and saying, 'It is true! The Lord has risen and has appeared to Simon.'

verses.zh: 两个人就把路上所遇见和擘饼的时候怎样被他们认出来的事，都述说了一遍。
verses.en: Then the two told what had happened on the way, and how Jesus was recognized by them when he broke the bread.

verses.zh: 正说话的时候，耶稣亲自站在他们当中，说：'愿你们平安！'
verses.en: While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, 'Peace be with you.'

verses.zh: 他们却惊慌害怕，以为所看见的是魂。
verses.en: They were startled and frightened, thinking they saw a ghost.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们为什么愁烦？为什么心里起疑念呢？
verses.en: He said to them, 'Why are you troubled, and why do doubts rise in your minds?

verses.zh: 你们看我的手，我的脚，就知道实在是我了。摸我看看，魂无骨无肉，你们看，我是有的。'
verses.en: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have.'

verses.zh: 说了这话，就把手和脚给他们看。
verses.en: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and feet.

verses.zh: 他们正喜得不敢信，并且希奇，耶稣就说：'你们这里有什么吃的没有？'
verses.en: And while they still did not believe it because of joy and amazement, he asked them, 'Do you have anything here to eat?'

verses.zh: 他们便给了他一片烧鱼（有古卷在此有）。
verses.en: They gave him a piece of broiled fish,

verses.zh: 他接过来，在他们面前吃了。
verses.en: and he took it and ate it in their presence.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'这就是我从前与你们同在之时，所告诉你们的话，说：摩西的律法、先知的书，和诗篇上所记的，凡指着我的话，都必须应验。'
verses.en: He said to them, 'This is what I told you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets and the Psalms.'

verses.zh: 于是耶稣开他们的心窍，使他们能明白圣经，
verses.en: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

verses.zh: 又对他们说：'照经上所写的，基督必受害，第三日从死里复活，
verses.en: He told them, 'This is what is written: The Messiah will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,

verses.zh: 并且人要奉他的名传悔改、赦罪的道，从耶路撒冷起直传到万邦。
verses.en: and repentance for the forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 你们就是这些事的见证。
verses.en: You are witnesses of these things.

verses.zh: 我要将我父所应许的降在你们身上，你们要在城里等候，直到你们领受从上头来的能力。'
verses.en: I am going to send you what my Father has promised; but stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.'

verses.zh: 耶稣领他们到伯大尼的对面，就举手给他们祝福。
verses.en: When he had led them out to the vicinity of Bethany, he lifted up his hands and blessed them.

verses.zh: 正祝福的时候，他就离开他们，被带到天上去了。
verses.en: While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken up into heaven.

verses.zh: 他们就拜他，大大的欢喜，回耶路撒冷去，
verses.en: Then they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

verses.zh: 常在殿里称颂神。
verses.en: And they stayed continually at the temple, praising God.
